loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, es una persona que desde su infancia ha aprendido a trabajar para salir adelante,  a los 18 años se dedicaba a vender lotería, luego cambio de actividad económica hoy en día vende ropa, calzado, artículos plásticos y productos de temporada, su negocio lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., también depende como estén sus ventas, debido a su experiencia se organiza muy bien para mantener un inventario que sea del gusto de sus clientes. Es madre soltera y disfruta de sus cuatro hijos de 18, 15, 13 y 8 años, vive junto a ellos pues es el pilar principal de la familia.
Comprará ropa ambos sexos, artículos navideños, diferentes artículos plásticos, con lo que estará  preparada para la temporada navideña, generara ingresos con los que ampliara poco a poco el negocio y pagara sus deudas.
Anhela apoyar incondicionalmente a sus hijos en sus estudios y que sean profesionales con oportunidades de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Benilda is a person who since she was very young learned to work in order to get ahead. At 18 she started to sell lottery tickets and later changed her commercial activities. Today she sells clothes, shoes, plastic goods and seasonal items. She takes care of her business from 7 am until 5 pm, but also dependent on how her sales are. Because of her experience she knows how to maintain her inventory to satisfy her customers. She is a single mother who enjoys her four children, aged 8, 13, 15 and 8. They live with her, Benilda being the center of the family. 

Benilda will buy clothing for both sexes, Christmas goods and plastic goods. With this she will be ready for the holiday season, generating income which little by little will expand her business and pay her debts. She longs to support her children unconditionally in their studies, that they become professionals with the possibility of a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for both sexes, Christmas items and a variety of plastic goods.

loans.name: Varujan

texts.en:
Varujan is an experienced agronomist from Paruyr Sevak village of the Ararat region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, six-year-old granddaughter and four-year-old grandson. To take care of his family's needs, Varujan has been extensively engaged in agribusiness for more than ten years. He is involved in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding livestock of sheep and pigs, and in the cultivation of watermelon, apricot and grapes. His family members help him greatly in his everyday farming activities; his son sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

The barn of the livestock is currently in poor condition and needs to be renovated. To sustain his agribusiness and make it more productive, Varujan needs a loan of 2,600 USD to renovate the barn and purchase forage for the livestock. Varujan and his big family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn and purchase forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, solicita otro crédito para surtir el negocio, comprara variedad de zapatos, arroz, frijol, aceite, y otros artículos de la canasta básica, para ella ha sido de mucho benefició los prestamos pues ha tenido mejores ingresos, un negocio más amplio, ha salido de sus deudas responsablemente.
Ha mejorado mucho las condiciones familiares, les da a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, salud, y ellos la apoyan en cada momento para que juntos puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lilian is requesting another loan in order to stock her business. She will buy a variety of shoes, rice, beans, oil, and other basic needs items. For her, the loans have been very beneficial, as she has had better income and a more extensive business. She has paid off her debts responsibly.

Her family’s conditions have improved a lot. She gives her children better food and health, and they support her every moment so that together, they can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes, rice, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced agronomist from Masis village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two sons and her elderly mother-in-law who receives a pension. Anahit works as a teacher in the village's local school. Her younger son is a contractual serviceman in the military. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries. To be able to make ends meet, Anahit is engaged in breeding livestock of pigs, piglets and hens as well as in the cultivation of wheat, apricot, cherry and grapes. Her family members assist her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. Anahit's husband and elder son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anahit needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase some forage for the livestock and buy fertilizers. As this is Anahit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products because they had no credit history. Anahit and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for the livestock and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Pedro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Pedro trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y refacción de su vehículo, así pues Pedro tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y seguirá trabajando con el deseo de lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 21-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica with his wife and their young child. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and dedicates all his efforts toward getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Pedro wasn’t able to study for a professional career. 

Through his own initiative, Pedro works as a mototaxi driver, offering transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours, and he believes that it’s going well for him because of his dedication. 

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will cover the maintenance and repair costs for his vehicle. Therefore, Pedro will have his work equipment in better condition, and he will continue working with the desire to achieve his great dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is an agronomist from Kapan city of the Syunik region. He lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter. To take care of his family’s needs, Ashot works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to fully cover the family’s needs. In addition to his main job, Ashot is also engaged in cattle breeding. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for his family. 

As life is getting more expensive day by day, Ashot needs to expand his agribusiness to more effectively meet the family's needs. He needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase two cows and a calf. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Ashot was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ashot and his family will be thankful to all lenders for helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a calf.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luis no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Luis trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de una empresa procesadora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres, ya que desea reforzar las paredes, pintarlas y ponerle piso, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is a twenty-one year old single man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and has a strong desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Luis has been unable to study a professional career.

By his own initiative, Luis works in maintenance at a processing company in his city. He works every day for approximately ten hours, and he believes that it's going well because of his dedication and good work performance. 

Luis is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to improve his parents' home since he wants to reinforce the walls, paint them, and install flooring, so he will be able to continue working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to improve his housing.

loans.name: Srbuhi

texts.en:
Srbuhi is from Nor Kharberd village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband (in the photo). Srbuhi works in the government sector, in the orphanage, as a babysitter. Her salary alone, however, is not enough to cover the family's expenses. With the help of her husband, she is engaged in the cultivation of potato and greens. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for her family.

Srbuhi and her husband also make besom and sell it in the local market. To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Srbuhi needs a loan of 1,300 USD to purchase fertilizers and needed materials for making besom. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Srbuhi was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Srbuhi and her husband will be thankful to all lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and needed materials for making besom

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Jesselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en: Erlita is 57 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Erlita has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from raising chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ituau

texts.en: Ituau is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Ituau has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and weed sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Ituau hopes to expand her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and weed sprayer.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 56 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is widowed with 4 children.                   

To earn a living, Marina has a business selling "bibingka and puto" (a native delicacy made of rice and coconut milk) cooked in a native oven. She earns about 5,000 pesos each month doing this type of work. Marina has requested a loan of 12,000 pesos to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business.                                                                                                         

Marina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she would like to expand her food vending business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, ha crecido en su negocio y hoy la demanda de sus clientes son, mayores, pues ha logrado aumentar su clientela, con el crédito anterior adquirió la materia prima que le permitió trabajar si limitantes por un tiempo, genero ganancias que antes no tenía pero que necesitaba, cancelo sus deudas.
Comprará frijoles, chicharrones, maíz, repollos y bebidas, contando con su inventario muy surtido podrá tener un negocio muy competitivo, tendrá mejores ingresos, y seguirá sirviendo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora has grown her business and today the demand from her customers is much greater. She has managed to increase her clientele. With her previous loan, she acquired the basic materials that allowed her to work without any limitations for some time. She generated revenues that she previously did not have, but needed. She paid off her debts.

Dora will buy beans, pork rinds, corn, cabbage and drinks. With a well-stocked inventory, she will be able to have a very competitive business. She will have better earnings and continue to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy beans, pork rinds, corn, cabbage and drinks.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: As a single parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Judith is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to resell for her buy-and-sell fish business. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida works hard to support her family. Leonida is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials. Leonida has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Leonida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Taman Sari Group

texts.en:
Entering the fifth loans, most of the members of Taman Sari group has 3 to 4 local pigs for pig barbecue. The local pigs will sell every two months.

As the head, Luh Eka became a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs. She has two now, and will give birth soon. She prefers the piglets. She will sell the piglets for fattening. 

She’s really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK, and the lenders for supporting her business and the group. Now she can support her husband’s income to fulfill their daily needs.

Two of the members couldn't attend the meeting. The head, Luh Eka, couldn't attend the meeting because she's gone to the city, and the meeting is lead by the secretary of the group.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Yamileth De La Concepcion

texts.es: Yamileth de la Concepción  acompañada con un hijo menor de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa de adultos, niños, cosméticos, prendas de oro, entre otros sus compras las realiza en otros municipios del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Yamileth desde muy temprano sale a entregar la mercadería encargada y a ofrecer a otros clientes nuevos productos. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su negocio y así suplir con las demandas que ahora tiene debido a que se acerca la navidad y poder brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yamileth de la Concepción has a partner and a child who is under the age of majority and still under her care. She is from one of the municipalities in Chinandega. She works in the sale of general merchandise, such as children's and adult's clothing, cosmetics, gold jewellery and other items. She makes her purchases in different communities in the country. She makes her sales in cash and on credit, and she collects payments weekly and biweekly. She has both long-standing and one-time customers. Yamileth goes out very early to deliver the merchandise that people have ordered, and to offer other customers new products.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in her business. This will help her to meet the demand that she currently has given that Christmas is coming, and it will allow her to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase different styles and sizes of clothes for adults and children, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice grains. Jenny is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Imelda has been in this business for 6 years. Imelda earns more income from pig fattening.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Golden Dove Center Group

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.                         

Pacita is a farmer and grows palay and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like farm inputs and fertilizers.                                                             

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more palay and corn products.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 46 years old and lives in Danlugan. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Narcisa has a business selling goods and dry goods. She earns about 25,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

Narcisa has requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She became a member of PMPC this year. Narcisa hopes to open a mini grocery store as an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is 31 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sucett is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sucett has been raising pigs for 2 years, and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Elisa has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell rice business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nuanua

texts.en: Nuanua is a 64 year old widowed woman with 5 children. She has a huge plantation where she grows taro, yams and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Nuanua needs a loan to buy iron roofing materials, timber, nails, bush knives and a weed-sprayer for her farm work. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Nuanua will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing materials, timber, nails, bush knives and a weed-sprayer for her farm work

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is running a buy-and-sell business in order to provide for the needs of her four children. She buys newly harvested rice, and sells it in volume in town to make a living. A portion of her stocks will be used for their consumption. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, Merly wants to repair their house for a more comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is  married with seven children and lives in Clarin. She and her husband operate their own coconut farm to earn a living. She has grown and harvested coconuts for ten years and she earns a decent profit. She makes additional income from pig raising. Rita joined GDMPC in 2008 and her previous loan that was used for the farm was successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to buy feed and piglets for her piggery business. She plans to use the additional profits to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Domestica

texts.en:
Domestica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a duck and chicken egg selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional eggs to sell.  Domestica has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Domestica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory of soap, charcoal, spices, among other things to sell.

Norma has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Norma aspires to save enough money so she can buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of soap, charcoal, spices and other things to sell

loans.name: Leonis

texts.en:
Leonis is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Leonis earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Leonis has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Perise

texts.en: Perise is 29-years-old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and ta'amu, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years. Perise needs a loan to buy a weed-sprayer, bush-knives, chemicals and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a weed-sprayer, bush knives, chemicals and a wheelbarrow for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Salusiva

texts.en: Salusiva is 34 years old and single with 2 children. She has a plantation which grows coconuts, cocoa, bananas, taro and other things. She has been farming for 3 years. Salusiva has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush-knives, a crowbar and a chain saw. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her profits, she plans to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, a crowbar and a chain saw

loans.name: Dang

texts.en:
Dang was born in 1993. He lives in Bac Ninh province. He is in a pharmaceutical major at Hanoi Pharmacy University. His courses lasts 50 months, and he will be graduating in June, 2016. His education fee is subsidized by his parent. The woman who is standing next to him in this picture is his mother.

Dang’s family has six members. His parents are farmers. He has a brother and a sister. He is the only person in his family who has a higher education. His family’s income is about 15,000,000 VND per month. 

Dang has a passion for his major. He believes that studying this major will help him take care of his family well. He also understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paying job, bring income to his family, and get a better life in future. 

He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for his education fees. If he can access this loan, his studying can’t be interrupted. He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has been very supportive to the education of student in Vietnam. He also hopes that this program can be expanded to help more students.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Samoa

texts.en:
Samoa is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation, and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Samoa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, rakes, crops and bush-knives.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Samoa hopes to improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, rakes, crops, and bush-knives.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soaps, shampoos, etc., for her general store business.

Belen has been in this business for 25 years. Belen earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en: Nova is 34 years old; she is married and has two children, both are in grade school. She lives in Poblacion Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a tricycle driver and that sustains their daily bread. She has engaged in parlor business for more than four years and earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Nova has requested a new loan to purchase parlor supplies. She aims for a better future through her business.

loans.use: to buy parlor supplies for her barber shop business.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is 34 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling cup & bowl noodles, buns, etc. in her community and has been doing this for two years. Litia has requested a loan to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, twisties, eggs, coffee, and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Litia will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, twisties, eggs, coffee, and foam cups for her food stall business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 48 years old; she is married and has six adult children. She lives in Misom Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Rosita has engaged in a rice farming business of their own rice farm. She has been in this business for eight years and earns a monthly income of PHP 8,000. She requested a new loan to purchase three sacks of rice fertilizers. Rosita is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2009. She dreams of having enough savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of rice fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is married with two children. He is managing his own farm of rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for twenty years, earning good enough for their living. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to improve his farm. He is hoping to gain more profit and be able to use it for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jinky works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. Jinky is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Jinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is helping her husband on their farm to earn a living. Aside from farming, she has also been engaged in a buy and sell business. She has also grown and harvested coconuts for more than six years. She joined GDMPC in 2011. The previous loan she used for their farm has been successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and salt to improve the farm. 

In the future, Perla hopes to help her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and salt.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 51 years old. She has one adult child and is a single parent. She lives in SWP Calamba Misamis Occidental. Gloria has engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000. Gloria requested a new loan to purchase various groceries to sell to her customers. Gloria is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2004. She hopes to gain maximum earnings from her business.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Siliulumoega

texts.en: Sileulumoega is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. She has a huge plantation that grows ta'amu, bananas, and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Sileulumoega has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, bush knives, and a chainsaw. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Sileulumoega hopes to improve her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, bush knives and a chainsaw for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 51 years old and married with ten children.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 34, has two children and helps her husband in managing their transportation business. For more than five years in running the business, their earnings are good enough for their daily needs. In 2009, she joined GDMPC and her previous loans used to buy spare parts was successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan to purchase new set of tires. 

Jenelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family by sustaining and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 49 years old. She is married and has two high school students. She lives in Mabini Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer of a small parcel of rice farm. Rosemarie has engaged in sari-sari (variety) store business for five years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,500. Rosemarie is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2006. She requested a new loan to purchase various groceries in her sari-sari store. She hopes her children will be able to graduate and become successful.

loans.use: To purchase various sales for her general store business.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba, aged 38, is a married entrepreneur from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She has an only child and earns a living from her transport service business. Melba joined GDMPC in 2011 and her previous loans used for the motorcycle were successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of motor repair and buy spare parts. In the future, Melba wants to have another unit of motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor repair and buy spare parts for her transportation business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is 38 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in Balasdiot Baliangao Misamis Occidental, Luzminda has engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years and earns a monthly income of PHP 7,000. She requested a new loan to buy additional sales items for her store and sacks of rice, corn, and feed. Luzminda is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2004. She aims to earn a better savings from her business.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of rice and five sacks of feed to sell to customers in her general store business.

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en: Sialei is 18 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, tomatoes, etc. in her community and has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a crowbar, wheelbarrow, and garden hose. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sialei will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a crowbar, wheelbarrow, and garden hose for her farming business.

loans.name: Palma Real Group

texts.es: presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carla tiene 19  años  ella se dedica a la  venta de  comida, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicada en Villa Pabon de la ciudad de La paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carla va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes, papa y aceite,  para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital. La Sra. Carla enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varios lugares que venden comida por la zona, pero el negocio de ella es muy concurrido y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos para su negocio, se siente  feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Carla is the president of her communal bank. She is nineteen years old and makes a living by selling food. Her stall is located in Villa Pabon in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first loan cycle with this institution. Carla is going to use this loan to purchase supplies, such as groceries, potatoes, and oil, for making the food for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her capital. Carla faces challenges in her business, such as competition since various places in the area sell food, but her business is very popular and she is going to use the profits to continue buying supplies for her business. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity you are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: María Ercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 68 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció, pero de esa relación tienen  3  hijos los mismos que fueron su fortaleza en esos momentos difíciles, ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
A doña María siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida por ella y su familia, junto a su marido adecuaron un local en su casa en el cual instalaron una papelería y librería, actualmente es la más grande y  concurrida de la ciudad, allí trabajan todos los días ella y sus hijos, en los meses que hay mas trabajo por la entrada a clases llegan unas hermanas de ella y sobrinos a ayudarles,  así ella sale adelante y también su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar todo tipo de útiles escolares y libros para surtir su negocio. Lleva más de 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Dinámicas” meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua, which is known for being very dynamic and where the majority of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and raising animals as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Maria lives in Tosagua and is 68 years old. Several years ago her beloved husband passed away, but she has three children from her marriage and they were her strength in that difficult time. They are now grown up and are independent of her.

Maria has always liked earning a living for herself and her family. Together with her husband she set apart a space in her house, in which she set up a stationary store and bookstore, which is now the largest and busiest in the city. She and her children work there every day. In the months when there is more work due to classes starting, her sisters and their children come to help her. In this way she gets ahead and so does her family.

She is going to use this loan to purchase all types of school supplies and books with which to stock her business. She has been a part of the communal bank for fourteen years and she likes it because the loans are fast and are a lot of help. Her dream is to continue getting ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and books

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Veronique est une présidente adjointe de l’association  d’affaire  « Heri ya Mungu », senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans  et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son conjoint un enseignant dans une école officielle. La cliente est  une vendeuse de souliers  Elle installe ses marchandises  dans un quartier animé, surtout au long de la rue. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance d’un ami. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 paires de souliers.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Veronique is a deputy president of the business group "Heri ya Mungu", and a dynamic, experienced, senior entrepreneur.  She is 45 years old and mother to 8 children, who all attend school.  Her husband is a teacher in a state school.  Veronique sells shoes at the roadside, in a busy neighbourhood.  She started her business 4 years ago, with the help of a friend, and later, took a loan from the field partner, Hekima.  She will use this loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes.  Her earnings will be used to pay for her children's school expenses, expand her business and buy a plot of land for her children.

Veronique is very grateful to Hekima for helping unbankable, women entrepreneurs become autonomous, especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.  It should be noted that one of the borrowers is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mohliqoi

texts.ru:
Мохлико с района Хамадони, ей 21 год. Она в данный момент живет с родителями. У нее есть сын в возрасте 2,5 лет. Мохлико рано вышла замуж, однако ее семейная жизнь не сложилась и она развелась с мужем. Сейчас у нее трудный период. Чтобы отвлечь себя и для того чтобы не быть обузой для родителей, она решила начать собственное дело. Мохлико у местной портнихи научилась кроить и шить женские национальные платья и теперь хочет сама заняться этим делом профессионально, чтобы обеспечивать себя и своего сына. Для реализации задуманного у нее не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Мохлико собирается купить модернизированную швейную машинку и начать швейное дело. Ее мать всячески поддерживает ее и в дальнейшем будет помогать ей в новом бизнесе. 
Мохлико уже нашла своих первых клиенток: это будут ее родственники, близкие, друзья и соседи.
texts.en: Mohliqoi is from the Hamadoni region, she is 21 years old. At this time she lives with her parents. She has a two and a half year old son. Mohliqoi has married early, but her family life did not work out and she has divorced her husband. Right now she has a difficult period. To keep herself busy and not be a burden for her parents she has decided to start her own business. Mohliquoi has learned from a local seamstress how to sew traditional women's dresses and now wants to start doing this professionally to provide for herself and her son. To make this happen she does not have enough money. This is why she has come to ask for a loan. Mohliqoi wants to buy a modernized sewing machine to start a sewing business. Her mother supports her any way she can and will be helping her in her new business in the future. Mohliqoi has already found hew first customers, they will be her relatives and close ones, friends and neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a modernized sewing machine to start a sewing business.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru: Акмалджон трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в 1968 года. Акмалджон 15 лет назад начал свой бизнес купле продажей, так как он нуждался деньгах. Акмалджон торгует на местном рынке. Он сегодня успешно введет своё дело, а 15 лет назад ему было очень трудно организовать свой бизнес, так как у него не было поддержки. Акмалджон заботливый отец 4 детей. Его жена тоже занимается бизнесом. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Несмотря на то что они работают упорно, в течении многих лет не могут отремонтировать их дом. Дом Акмалджона старый и имеет плохое состояние. Акмалджон запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Akmaljon is a hardworking man. He was born in 1968. Akmaljon has started his own business fifteen years ago buying and reselling as he was in need for money. He sells on the local market. Today he is running his business successfully, but fifteen years ago it was very difficult for him to start his own business because he did not have support. Akmaljon is a caring father of four children. His wife also does business, she provides sewing services. Even though they work very hard they are not able to repair their house for many years. Akmaljon's house is old and is not in good condition. Akmaljon is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni to buy building materials such as wood, cement and paint. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Buki Group

texts.fr:
Siméon  fait partie du groupe  Buki et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 27 et est marié à Jeanette. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 7 à 15 ans, dont 3 étudient. 
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants qui étudient, membres de sa famille élargie.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot,huile de palme)et du manioc sec   depuis 14 ans. 

C’est premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 50kg de riz, 50kg de haricot, 100kg de manioc sec,  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Siméon, age 27, is a member of Buki Group. He lives in Bubanza and is married to Jeannette. They have four children together, aged 7 to 15. Three of them go to school. Siméon also has to provide for two school-attending children who are part of his extended family.

For fourteen years, he's been running a small store where he sells rice, beans, palm oil, and dried cassava. This is his first loan with Kiva's partner, Turame.

With this Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy 50 kg of rice, 50 kg of beans, and 100 kg of dried cassava. He will resell them to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of rice, 50 kg of beans, and 100 kg of dried cassava

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tulinabo est une trésorière du collectif de crédit «Lumière », jeune cliente, dynamique, âgée de 25 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son conjoint est un chauffeur  auprès d’une compagnie commerciale. La cliente est entrepreneur et sociétaire d’un restaurant.  Elle s’installe dans un quartier populaire animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les aliments (3 kg de viande, 3 sacs de pomme de terre, 1 sac de braise, 25 kg de haricots, 5 litres d’huile, riz, bananes plantains, épices, etc). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de restaurant et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.  Les vols, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Tulinabo is the treasurer of the Lumière Group.  She is a young, dynamic woman, 25 years old, and mother to 3 children who all attend school.  Her husband is a driver for a commercial company.  Tulinabo is an entrepreneur and shareholder in a restaurant.  She works in a busy, working-class area.  She started her business 4 years ago, with the help of her husband, and later took a loan with the field partner Hekima.  She will use this loan to buy food (3 kgs of meat, 3 sacks of potatoes, 1 sack of charcoal, 25 kgs of beans, 5 litres of oil, rice, plantains, spices, etc).  In this way, she hopes to pay the school expenses of her children, expand her restaurant business and buy a plot of land for her children.

Theft, non-payment of debts and exchange rate losses are all big challenges to the development of her business.

Tulinabo is grateful to Hekima for helping non-bankable, women entrepreneurs become autonomous, particularly at this critical moment of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 34 ans qui, depuis 03 ans achète du poisson frais dans des poissonneries qu'elle revend dans un marché de la ville après les avoir transformer en poisson fumé. son dynamisme lui a permis de constituer en peu de temps un important portefeuille clientèle. 
elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter du poulet qu'elle va également sécher avant de revendre afin de diversifier ses marchandises et attirer encore plus de clientèle. les bénéfices générés lui permettront non seulement de se lancer dans l’élevage de porc, une activité dont elle a toujours rêvé, mais aussi de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Martine is a young 34-year-old Cameroonian who has been buying fish from fishmongers, smoking it and reselling it at a market in town for 3 years. Her dynamic attitude has enabled her to build a large customer base in a short amount of time. She would like to use this loan to buy some chicken which she will dry and resell in order to diversify her merchandise and attract even more customers. The profits generated by her business will allow her to start breeding pigs, a business she has always dreamed of starting, as well as to better take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Marie Cliffode

texts.fr: Marie Cliffode est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 26 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant âgé de 08 ans qui va à l'école. Comme activité malgré son jeune age, elle achète des liqueurs, vins spiritueux et autres produits alimentaires qu'elle revient revendre dans un marché de la place. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter les liqueurs en grande quantité pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux assurer la scolarité de son enfant. elle a pour ambition de devenir une grande importatrice de liqueur.
texts.en: Marie Cliffode is a young 24-year-old Cameroonian who is single and the mother of an 8-year-old child who attends school. Despite her young age, she runs a business buying liqueurs, alcoholic wines and food products which she resells at a local market. She would like to use this loan to buy a large amount of liqueurs in order to increase her inventory so that she is able to satisfy her customer demand. The income that she earns will enable her to ensure that her child gets an education. Her aim is to become a large importer of liqueurs.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of liqueurs.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Ismaila est marié et père de famille et c’est grâce aux recettes de son activité qu’il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Pour améliorer les conditions de son travail, il a besoin d’acheter un nouvel appareil de photo de genre numérique, c’est pourquoi, il fait appel à l’IMCEC pour satisfaire ce besoin. Ismaila travaille de 9 heures du matin à 19 heures du soir. 
Avec les revenus de son activité, il  peut prend en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et mettre de l’argent de cote. 
Il a comme ambition, d’ouvrir un labo-photo et de développer son activité.
texts.en:
Ismaila is married and a father and it's thanks to the income from his business that he is able to manage his household's daily expenses. In order to improve his working conditions, he needs to buy a new digital camera. He is turning to UIMCEC in order to satisfy this need.

Ismaila works from 9 o'clock in the morning until 7 o'clock at night. He uses the income from his business to cover his children's education expenses and build his savings. His ambition is to open a photo lab and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his business.

texts.es:
Janet, de 47 años, originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona  de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal.

Gracias a su esfuerzo desde hace 16 años tiene por actividad económica un taller de  sastrería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar material de costura como telas, sedinas botones, zíper, agujas, carretes, cintas, forros. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Janet agradece la ayuda de los que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas  escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Janet, 47, is from León which is located in the western part of the country.  She is known as a hard-working, responsible person with a desire for personal development.

Thanks to her efforts of 16 years she earns a living as a seamstress in the workshop set up in her home.  She spends 12 hours a day keeping up with customer demand.  The purpose of the loan is to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, needles, spools, ribbon and lining fabric so she can earn more income in the near future.

Janet is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua have decent work.

loans.name: Maxima Audely

texts.es: Máxima Audely mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, turismo, y sus hermosas playas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal. Es una microempresaria que se dedica a al compra y venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para niños y adultos, como ropa interior, chinería, zapatos, cosméticos ente otros. Ella realiza sus compras en mercados de otro municipios del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito el cual ofrece a clientes y comerciantes de diferentes mercados del municipio, al igual que por las noches ella realiza fritanga donde ofrece: maduros fritos con queso, tajadas, gallo pinto, pollo asado, carne asada, enchiladas, tacos entre otros. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y lograr aprovechar sus mejores temporadas de ventas como es en estos momentos. Máxima esta muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Máxima Audely is a single woman with two children in her care.  She is from the town of Chinandega which is located in the western part of the country, where there are beautiful beaches, and commerce and tourism are the predominant businesses.  

Máxima is known for being a responsible, hard-working woman with a great desire for personal development.  She is a small business owner who buys and sells general merchandise such as adult's and children's clothing, lingerie, trinkets, shoes, cosmetics and other items.  She buys goods at markets in other cities and sells products for cash or on credit to customers and merchants in different markets in her area.  At night she makes and sells fried bananas, rice and beans, roast chicken, enchiladas, tacos, etc.  

The purpose of this loan is to have work capital to be able to take advantage of the current season when sales are higher.  Máxima is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for their support of people with low income.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Pathe

texts.fr:
Monsieur Pathé, âgé de 46 ans, est un photographe de profession, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Pour renouveler  ses outils de travail, il a besoin d’acheter un nouvel appareil de photo numérique. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour régler ce problème latent. 
Pathé travaille de 10 h du matin à 14 h de l’après-midi. Son activité lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille, et de mettre des fois un peu d’argent de cote pour faire fasse a de probables imprévus.
Pathé rêve d’un grand projet, celui d’avoir son propre labo de photo.
texts.en:
Pathé is 46 years old and married with 3 children.  He is a professional photographer and has more than 10 years experience.  In order to keep his business equipment up to date, he needs to buy a new digital camera.  To help with this, he has requested this loan from the field partner UIMCEC.  

Pathé works from 10am until 2pm.  Thanks to his business, he is able to provide for the needs of his family and put some money aside to cover any unforeseen future expenses.  Pathé has an ambitious plan for the future, he would like to have his own photographic laboratory.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his business.

loans.name: G.s. Maravillosas Group

texts.es:
El G.S. Las Maravillosas está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras originarias de León,  lugar que está ubicado en el occidente del país. Este grupo se caracteriza por ser mujeres trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, que lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, por falta de recursos económicos, y luchan día a día para poder mantener su negocio y su familia.

Gracia a su esfuerzo la coordinadora del g.s Las Maravillosas es  Juana y tiene por actividad económica la venta de Manzanas y artesanía ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Las Maravillosas agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Maravillosas communal bank is made up of three members who are single mothers from León. It is located in the western part of the country. This group is described as being hardworking, responsible women who wants to get ahead personally. Unfortunately they were unable to go to school due to a lack of financial resources and they fight day to day to be able to support their businesses and their families. 

Thanks to her hard work, Juana is the coordinator of Las Maravillosas. Her economic activity is selling apples and handmade crafts from her house. She works at her business 10 hours a day, offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling merchandise so that in the not so distant future she can obtain better income. The Las Maravillosas group is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors have given to people of low income in poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling apples and handmade crafts.

loans.name: Graciela Fernanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Graciela, tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tienen una hija de  14 años de edad la misma que estudia en colegio.
Doña Graciela para salir adelante  sola y no depender de nadie se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo aunque lo que más vende es ropa interior, los fines de semana  ella instala un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, ella también el resto de la semana cuando está desocupada visita a sus clientes que siempre le compran y también vende en su casa  si algún cliente desea alguna prenda. Tiene más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su hija.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa interior. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y seguros. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Dinámicas" meets every 15 days in the city of Tosagua which is known for being very dynamic and a place where most of the local people are involved in agriculture and livestock farming due to the abundant vegetation in the area.

This is where Graciela, 36, lives.  She is divorced and has a 14-year-old daughter who attends school.  In order to be independent and not have to depend on anyone, Graciela earns a living as a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing, but mostly lingerie.  On weekends she sets up a small stand in the center of town where many merchants offer their products.  During the rest of the week she visits customers who always buy from her and also sells from home if anyone wants to buy anything.

She has been in business for nine years and is able to support her daughter this way.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and lingerie.  For eight years she has been a member of the communal bank; and she likes the fact that the loans are quick and dependable.  Her dream is to give her daughter the best she can.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and lingerie.

loans.name: Jhon Elias

texts.es:
Jhon vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el se dedica al cultivo de frutos de la zona como el plátano, entre otros; el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de humilde trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Jhon está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, gastos de riego, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mantener su cultivo y de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una buena cosecha y poder sembrar mas hectáreas de frutas”.
texts.en:
Jhon lives in the city of Pucallpa and earns a living as a crop farmer growing bananas and other fruit.  He works about nine hours a day and is able to earn an income from his humble work in order to get ahead.

Jhon is very grateful for the support he is receiving so he can buy fertilizers and pay irrigation costs, among other things.  This allows him to maintain his business and continue striving toward his goal of "Having a good harvest and planting more acres of fruit".

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1993. She lives with her family in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. She learns about banking and finance at Phuong Dong University in Hanoi. Her courses last 40 months and she will graduate in 2015. The woman who is sitting next to her in this picture is her mother. 

Anh’s family has five members. She has two younger brothers. Her parents are farmers. She is the first person in her family who has studied at a  university. Her family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND. She is now worrying a bit because the economy is slowing down and it’s very difficult to find a job with the major she is learning at present. But she still believes that the economy is recovering and she will have a good job after finishing her studies. 

She wants to borrow 7,956,000 VND to pay for her education fees. Aside from lacking the money to pay for her education fees, she has other difficulties such as a lack of studying tools. Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en: Lokapeta is 42 years old and lives with her partner with no children. She owns and operates a small store at home, selling items such as cigarettes, sugar, flour, milk and matches. She has been doing this for two years now. Lokapeta needs a loan to buy cigarettes, flour, sugar, mosquito coils, rice, cooking oil, matches and milk. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, flour, sugar, mosquito coils, rice, cooking oil, matches and milk.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles mayor de edad acompañada con un hijo aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, es propietaria de un taller de costura ubicada en su casa de habitación donde realiza diferentes estilos de ropa para niños, uniformes escolares, empresariales, de primera comunión, entre otros, también se dedica a venta de mercadería en general como: venta de ropa juvenil, sandalias, cosméticos, chinerías, entre otros, sus compras son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito. El objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de: hilos de todos colores, telas, agujas, zipper, encanjes, cosméticos, chinerias entre otros y aprovechar sus mejores temporadas de ventas y así tener variedad de estilos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Maria agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: María de los Ángeles is an adult in a common law marriage with a son she is still responsible for. She is from the town of Chinandega and the owner of a sewing workshop located in her house. She makes different styles of children's clothing, school uniforms, business uniforms, first communion clothing, and more. She also sells general merchandise such as: youth clothing, sandals, cosmetics, chinoiserie, and more. She pays for her purchases up front and has regular and occasional customers. She gets paid up front and on credit. The purpose of this loan is for working capital to buy: all colors of thread, fabric, needles, zippers, lace, cosmetics, chinoiserie, and more. It is also to take advantage of the best sales season and have a variety of styles to offer her customers. Maria is grateful to the Kiva investors for the support they offer people of low income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital such as: cosmetics, chinoiserie, threads, different styles and colors of fabrics, and more.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is married with two children. Digna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Digna is a farmer who grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to buy five sacks of hog mash. Digna has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Digna hopes to have a piggery at her place.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of hog mash.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fish to make dried fish for her business.

Remedios has been in this business for 20 years. Remedios earns additional income from raising pigs.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Letecia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase household items like soap, milk, coffee, sugar, chips, bread and canned goods for her general store business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase household items like soap, milk, coffee, sugar, chips, bread and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 41 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene  dos hijos de 19 y 15  años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio  y vive con su papá en Guayaquil mientras estudia, Ella tiene su casa propia allí vive con el hijo mayor. 
Doña Martha para salir adelante junto a su familia desde hace dos años surtió una  tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayudan en su negocio y su hija los fines de semana ya que ella viaja a Guayaquil solo los días que tiene clases. Es así como ella sale adelante y le gusta ya que allí además de ganarse la vida se distrae con su trabajo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 1 año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante aumentando su negocio con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Dinamicas communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is a place with a lot of vegetation. This is where Martha lives. She is 41 years old and separated. From her relationship she has two children, aged 19 and 15. The youngest is in high school and lives with her father in Guayaquil while she goes to school. She has her own home and lives there with her older son.
 
In order to get ahead, two years ago Martha and her family opened a grocery store in her house. She sells all types of products there such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, legumes and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes later. Her son helps her in the business and her daughter does on the weekends, because she travels to Guayaquil only whens she has school. That is how she gets ahead and she likes it because in addition to earning a living, she stays busy with her work.  

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and more basic staple products. She has been in the communal bank for one year and she likes it because of the help they always give them in the group. Her goals are to keep going forward, growing her business with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and more basic staple products.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana  luisa, madre soltera con  un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de su hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, short, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa de cama, ropa de niño, ropa interior. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de mercadería, para  que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is a single mother of an underage son. She is originally from León, located in the West of the country. She is known to be hardworking, responsible and to have a strong will to progress. During her free time, she likes to spend some time with her son. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she could not study and had to work since she was young in order to contribute with some income. However, she would have liked to study at the university.

Thanks to her hard work and persistence, she is working now selling different types of clothes, such as pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, dresses, bed clothes, children clothes and underwear. With this loan, she wants to invest in working capital and stock her business, hoping to receive a better income in the near future. Ana appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give low-income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to stock her business. She will buy pants, shorts, shirts, skirts and children clothes, among other things.

loans.name: Faranisisi

texts.en:
Faranisisi is a 22-year-old married woman with 2 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faranisisi has requested a loan to buy a chain saw, crowbar and pickaxe.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Faranisisi hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a chain saw, crowbar and pickaxe

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 61 years old and married with four children.

Deborah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, chips and eggs.

Deborah has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Deborah aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, chips and eggs

loans.name: Lisset Yasmine

texts.es:
LISSET ES UNA JOVEN DE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA Y MUY EMPRENDEDORA.
ELLA ACAÓ SUS ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS EN EL MES DE AGOSTO DE ESTE AÑO, ACTUALMENTE SE ENCUENTRA LABORANDO EN EL PODER JUDICIAL DE SU LOCALIDAD.
LISSET, ESTUDIÓ DERECHO Y CIENCIAS POLITICAS EN UNA UNIVERSIDAD DE SU LOCALIDAD Y SE DECIDIÓ ESTUDIAR ESTÁ CARRERA POR SU VOCACION DE DEFENSA DE LOS DERECHOS DE LOS MÁS NECESITADOS.
EL PRÉSTAMO OTORGADO LE AYUDÓ A ELLA, HACER LOS PAGOS CORRESPONDIENTES PARA TRÁMITAR LOS DOCUMENTOS PARA SACAR EL BACHILLER Y POSTERIORMENTE SU TITULO.
UNO DE SUS MAS GRANDES SUEÑOS ES SER UNA PROFESIONAL RECONOCIDA Y ASÍ APOYAR A SUS PADRES.
LISSET ESTÁ MUY AGRADECIDA, YA QUE ES UNA AYUDA A TODOS LOS JOVENES COMO ELLA A SEGUIR ADELANTE Y CUMPLIR SUS METAS.
ELLA QUIERE DECIR A LOS SOCIOS DE KIVA : GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN NOSOTROS LOS JOVENES UNIVERSITARIOS.
texts.en:
Lisset is 27 years old, single, and very enterprising.

Lisset finished her university studies in August of this year and she is currently working in the local judiciary's office.

Lisset studied law and political sciences at her town's university.  She decided to study this degree because it is her vocation to defend the rights of those who most need help.

This loan will help Lisset to make the necessary payments to process the documents to complete her undergraduate degree and to apply for her degree certificate.

One of Lisset's biggest dreams is to become a renowned professional and to support her parents with her work.

Lisset is very grateful as this loan helps all sorts of young people, like her, to get ahead, and achieve their goals.

Lisset has this message for Kiva lenders: "Thank you for trusting in young university students."

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and her final degree title.

loans.name: Sahyly

texts.es:
Sahyly a sus a sus 58 años de edad es una mujer adulta con muchas fuerzas, con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas y con la convicción de que en algún momento sus sueños metas y planes se harán realidad. Ella es madre de un solo hijo el cual ya está sacado y en hogar a parte, ella es casada y tiene nueve años de educación pudiendo terminar el plan básico. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la caficultura y cuando no trabaja en el campo es comerciante dedicándose a la venta de pizza casera y plátano (fruta) desde hace más de 6 años que gracias a estas actividades ella puede ayudar a su esposo a generar más ingresos. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabajan es propio el cual compraron ya hace algún tiempo siendo sus clientes al final de cada temporada de café los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona y para el comercio de pizzas caseras y plátano (Fruta) sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Doña Sahyly ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos como: urea, abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger su cosecha de café logrando con esto proteger sus cultivos de café para lograr una excelente cosecha.
