Sus planes para el futuro es poder comprar un local o un establecimiento para poder abrir su negocio formalmente ya que el trabajo del campo a su edad no es muy favorable por lo que en un futuro cercano quiere también comprar maquinas como una despulpadora para ahorrar un poco de dinero ya que la variación del precio del café no asegura mantener buenas ganancias para poder contratar personal que pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
At 58 years old, Sahyly is still very strong and has many dreams and hopes.  She believes that someday soon, her dreams and plans will become a reality.  Sahyly is a mother to one son, who has now left home.  Sahyly is married and completed nine years of school, finishing her basic education.  Alongside her husband, Sahyly makes a living growing coffee.  When she is not working in the fields, she is a businesswoman - selling homemade pizzas and bananas.  She has been doing this work for six years and, thanks to this work, she is able to help her husband to earn a higher living.  Sahyly and her husband own the land they work - they bought it some years ago.  At the end of every season, Sahyly and her husband's customers for the coffee are intermediaries who come to the area.  For the pizza and banana business, customers are neighbours, friends and family of the couple.

Sahyly has applied for a loan from COMIXMUL in order to buy supplies such as urea, manure, herbicides, fertilisers, and more, in order to protect her coffee crops and so that she can have an excellent harvest.

In the future, Sahyly plans to buy premises where she can open her business more formally.  Growing coffee at her age is not very easy and so, in the near, future, Sahyly would also like to buy machines, such as a coffee pulper in order to save a little money.  The varying price of coffee means that good profits are not guaranteed and so it can be difficult to know whether to hire labourers or not.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Soraya María Catalina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Soraya, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 24, 22 y 20 años de edad, el menor estudian en universidad y es quien aun vive con ella. Su esposo tiene un comedor en Guayaquil.
Doña Soraya para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catálogos y toallas, esto último es lo mejores ganancias le deja,  su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los días y  además de salir a vender también  visita a las personas que  tiene a su cargo,  son como 60 personas que ella les toma los pedidos y por las cuales también gana. Lleva más de  15 años dedicada al comercio y  esto es su vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y toallas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the "Dinámicas" communal bank meets every fortnight.  Tosagua is known for being very dynamic - here the majority of inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising animals.  The area has a lot of vegetation.

And it is here that 42-year-old Soraya lives.  She is married and, with her husband, has three children, aged 24, 22, and 20 years old.  The youngest is studying at university and still lives at home.  Soraya's husband has a canteen in Guayaquil.

In order to earn a little on her own, Soraya has a business selling catalogue clothes and shoes, as well as towels.  The towels give her the highest profits.  Soraya sells from door-to-door.  She works every day, visiting her customers - she has some 60 people who make orders with her.  Soraya has been doing this work for over 15 years and it has become her life.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, and towels.  Soraya has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are a great help for her business.  Soraya's dream is to keep improving her business every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and towels.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina is 53 years old and married with 8 children. She makes and sells elei & printed materials to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Sosefina has requested a loan to buy elei carved boards, brushes, rollers and fabric paints. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy elei carved boards, brushes, rollers and fabric paints.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, tiene cuatro hijos de 15 años,12 años, 8 años y el último de 8 meses, los tres mayores estudian en escuela de la zona, vive en casa propia desde hace 11 años, cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito Santo Domingo de la Capilla en la provincia de Cutervo.

La actividad que realiza cliente es la cría, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, cuenta con siete cabezas de ganado vacuno (3 vacas, 1 toro, 3 becerros) se dedica ha esta labor hace 05 años, en el caserío Cedropampa, dicha labor la realiza todos los días de la semana, con los ingresos obtenidos de esta actividad el apoya a su familia a salir adelante.

Apolinar ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. El destino del crédito sera para compra de ganado vacuno, una vaca y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children (ages 15, 12, 8 and 8 months) in their own house in the rural district of Santo Domingo de la Capilla in the province of Cutervo. His three eldest children are in school. Apolinar is an upstanding man of great character who comes highly recommended as a borrower.

Apolinar makes a living raising and selling cattle, and he presently has seven head of cattle in his herd (3 cows, 1 bull and 3 calves). He started raising cattle 5 years ago in the village of Cedropampa, and he uses all his income to support his family. Apolinar works seven days a week.

With the support from this loan through Edpyme Alternativa, Apolinar plans to purchase another cow for his herd. He hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de Cayalti, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte, trasladando en su mototaxi a sus clientes de Cayalti a comunidades aledañas, Gustavo ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de una manera segura.
texts.en: Gustavo is 41.  He lives with his wife in the rural district of Cayalti, two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. He provides transportation services, driving clients in his mototaxi from Cayalti to neighboring communities.  Gustavo has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to repair his vehicle so he can continue to provide a safe taxi service.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Edilson Francisco

texts.es:
Edilson Francisco tiene51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío de Pan de Azúcar una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, la población se dedica al cultivo de algodón y arroz, comercio de animales pequeños, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tienen una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes en general, frutas y verduras para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, con esto generaran ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilson Francisco is 51 years old and lives with his family in the settlement of Pan de Azucar, a rural zone of Oyotun district. The local population cultivates cotton and rice and raises and sells small farm animals. The town is just 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast.

Edilson, with his family, operates a small general store in his home. He has requested a loan of 1,000 new sols to purchase general groceries, fruit, and vegetables, in order to offer his customers more variety.  With this purchase, he will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and married with four children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, sugar, and other household items to sell.

Emily has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 3 years, and she earns extra income from fishing.

Emily aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, sugar, and other household items to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 10 years. Emily earns additional income from a general store.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  buy land in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Asomaliu

texts.en:
Asomaliu is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She owns and operates a small store at home, selling items such as ice cream, chilly chocs, milk, sugar, rice, etc., which she has been doing for three years. 

Asomaliu is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use needs a loan to purchase rice, sugar, flour, salt, ice cream, ice pops, chilly chocs, milk, chicken, and cigarettes. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and support her immediate family members financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, salt, ice cream, ice pops, chilly chocs, milk, chicken, and cigarettes

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима педагог с большим опытом. Она более 35 лет работает в средней школе. Несколько лет назад она занималась собственным бизнесом, то есть купле продажей продуктов питания, но данное время она не занимается этим бизнесом. Рахима преподаёт русский язык и русскую литературу. Рахима несколько лет назад потеряла своего мужа. Он умер трагической смертью. Она одна воспитывает 2 детей. Рахима получает маленькую зарплату. Ее зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Рахима всегда стремиться к тому, чтобы обеспечить свою семью хорошим условием. Однако она вместе со своими детьми живет бедно и не имеет денег, чтобы купить продукты питания и печку на зиму. Скоро начнутся холода, а Рахима и ее семья не готова на зимний период. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1200 сомони для покупки продукты питания и печку. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rakhima is a teacher with a lot of experience. She has been working for more than 35 years at the high school. Several years ago she started operating her own business selling foodstuffs, but she is not involved with the business right now. Rakhima teaches Russian language and literature. She lost her husband a few years ago. He died tragically. She is now raising two children by herself, and earns a small income that is not enough to provide for the basic needs of her family. Rakhima has always tried to ensure a decent life for her family, But she and her family are poor and do not have enough money to buy food and a stove for winter. Soon the weather will turn cold, and Rakhima and her family are not ready for winter. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to buy food and a stove. She is counting on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy food items and a stove for winter

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru: Сироджидин родился в 1980 года. Он более 12 лет занимается услугами такси. Сироджидин очень заботливый отец 4 детей. Его жена занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Сироджидин является основным кормильцем семьи. Он уже хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела. Сироджидин должен отремонтировать свою автомашину. Однако он не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы отремонтировать автомашину. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход. Сироджидин мечтает, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование.
texts.en: Sirodjidin was born in 1980. He has been running a private taxi service for more than 12 years. He is a very thoughtful father of 4 children. His wife works in agriculture. Sirodjidin is the family’s main provider, and he knows all of the ins and outs of his work. He needs to repair his car, but he cannot afford to pay for the repairs. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni. This loan will help him to increase his income. He dreams of being able to send his children to college.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.  She earns additional income from goat fattening. 

Celsa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional vegetables. Celsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pruchasel vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zohirjon

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере  Зохирджона  занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Более 16  лет Зохирджона занимается скотоводством. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. Дети еще не имеют источника дохода. Он является основным кормильцем в семье. Для Зохирджона земледелие, то есть выращивание картошки, морковки, пшеницы не только для него является источником дохода, но и любимым занятием. Он с удовольствием работает на поле с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Он ценит каждую частичку своей земли и говорит себе, «земля- кормилица, спасибо!». Он планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 11000  сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The land is the foundation of business and the main source of income in Tadjikistan. Many people, such as Zohirdjon, farm for a living. For more than 16 years Zohirdjon has been engaged in animal husbandry. He is married and has 3 children, who are still too young to work for a living. So he is the family’s primary breadwinner. For Zokirdjon, agriculture, that is, growing potatoes, carrots, and wheat is not only a source of income, but his passion as well. He loves to work in the field from daybreak until dark. He appreciates every square foot of his land and tells himself that “the land is my meal ticket — thank you!”. He is planning to expand his business, but cannot afford to buy seed and fertilizer. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 11,000 somoni to buy these items. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Senerita is 58 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, German buns, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. Senerita has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, a gas burner and a large pot. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Senerita will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, a gas burner and a large pot

loans.name: Marc Jayson

texts.en:
Marc Jayson is a third-year student at La Salle University in Ozamiz City. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. Marc Jayson is the eldest son of four siblings. He always finds ways to pursue his dream of finishing his studies and be able to help his younger brothers for their future. 

Marc borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to pay school tuition fees for his second semester in third year, Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, Major in Operations Management.  He dreams to finish his studies and be able to work for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for his second semester, third year

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old and married with eight children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Virginia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Hermenia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Hermenia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Hermenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daisylen

texts.en:
Daisylen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling food. 

Daisylen is requesting a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts and other materials for her motorcycle transport business. Daisylen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Ángela Veronica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 26 y 25 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y  aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es dueño de un bus de transporte.
Doña Ángela es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, ropa interior y productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). La mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa aunque también sale a visitar a los clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva  más  de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Dinámicas Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a city known for being very dynamic.  The area has a lot of vegetation, so the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals.

Ángela, 43, lives here.  She's married and has two children from this relationship, ages 26 and 25.  They attend school and still live at home.  Her husband owns a transportation bus.

Ángela's a homemaker who sells all types of clothing to earn her own income and help pay for the household expenses: shoes, wallets, underwear, and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She makes most of her sales at home, although she also goes out to visit her customers.  She gives credit and collects payment weekly.  She has had this job for more than 18 years and it helps pay for her children's education.

This loan is to buy underwear, shoes, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.

Ángela has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the group is very close and reliable.  Her dream is that she and her family will have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, hotdogs, etc for her food vending business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, hotdogs, etc

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a roofing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Elita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional leaves and bamboo wood for her roofing business. Elita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase nipa leaves and bamboo wood

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Nelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Folorita

texts.en:
Folorita is 39 years old and married with three children. 

She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for many years. Folorita has requested a loan to buy flour, chicken, onion, garlic, a large pot and a gas burner. 

She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Folorita will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, onion, garlic, a large pot and a gas burner.

loans.name: Kava

texts.en:
Kava is 52 years old, married, and has six children. She has a taxi business, which she has been doing for two years. 

Kava is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy new tires, oil, and seat covers. She will use her profits to improve her business. Kava joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase new tires, oil, and seat covers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 59 years old, widowed, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling food.

Remedios is requesting her 24th loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell such as soap, milk, eggs, canned goods, etc. Remedios hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as soap, milk, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Maribel is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en:
Fuatai is 24 years old and has been living with her partner for five years. She has two children. 

She runs a small business selling fast foods in her community and has been doing this for many years. Fuatai has requested a loan to buy chicken, rice, sausages, curry powder, onions, garlic, mutton flaps and foam plates. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuatai will improve her business to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, sausages, curry powder, onions, garlic, mutton flaps and foam plates.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. Mary Ann earns more income from pre-paid mobile load.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, meat, etc

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. 

Edna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hardworking entrepreneur whose business is selling Natasha and MSE products in the Philippines. Sylvia has been in this business for 12 years. Sylvia earns additional income from selling pre-paid mobile loads.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her direct selling business.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.fr:
Clemence est une dame âgée de 45 ans, pas mariée mais qui vit en couple avec un homme. elle est également mère de 08 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 13 et 29 ans.comme activité, elle dispose d'un petit magasin de vente de produit alimentaire dans un quartier de la ville.Elle y vend aussi de la boisson. elle bénéficie de 13 ans d'expérience dans le domaine. Ce crédit vas lui donnait non seulement la possibilité d'augmenter son stock de marchandise car elle va les acheter en grande quantité, mais également elle va s'approvisionner en boisson directement aux Brasseries, et non plus dans les petits dépôts de boisson, avec pour objectif de bénéficier des ristournes.
elle a pour ambition de faire des économies pour ouvrir une grande alimentation.
texts.en:
Clemence is a 45 year old woman who is not married but lives with her partner.  She is mother to eight children between the ages of 13 and 29 years.  

Clemence runs a small food shop in a neighbourhood of her town.  She also sells drinks from her shop.  Clemence has thirteen years experience in this area of business.  She will use her loan to increase the size of her food stocks by buying in bulk.  She will also be able to buy her drinks directly from the breweries, rather than from small distributors, this will allow her to benefit from discounted prices.

Clemence's ambition is to save enough to be able to open a much larger food shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for her food shop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 43 years old, married and has four children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, toothbrushes, spices, bread, etc.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling water buffalo and pre-paid mobile loads.

Melinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, toothbrushes, spices, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and she earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Aurora has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Aurora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Aurora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 40 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past eight years, Hazel has run a business selling Avon products and MSE in the Philippines. 

Hazel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Edelma

texts.en:
Edelma is 48 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She operates a dressmaking and direct-selling business. Edelma started her dressmaking business in 1996. She was grateful because through her creativity and determination she was able to earn greater income, which she invested into her direct-selling business. 

Now, she aspires to have a continuous smooth flow income; that’s why she’s seeking additional capital to be used in buying stock of cosmetic products, garments and threads. She knows that this loan will have much to do with the increase of her sales and improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, garments and threads for her sewing business.

loans.name: Iasepi

texts.en:
Iasepi is 18 years old and married with one child. She has a small taxi business. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Iasepi needs a loan to buy brake pads, tires and brake fluid. She will use her profits to improve her business. Iasepi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy brake pads, tires and brake fluid.

loans.name: Malu

texts.en:
Malu is 28-year-old single lady with no child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as groceries, meat, etc. She has been in this business for many years. 

Malu needs a loan to buy chicken, noodles, milk, toilet paper, sugar, rice, and flour.  She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, noodles, milk, toilet paper, sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine for her husband

loans.name: Jeje May

texts.en:
Jeje May is a married parent of three who works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling Avon and Natasha products. Jeje May has sustained her business activities with her past 21 loans through NWTF.

Jeje May is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to maintain her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and materials to maintain her fishing business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married mother of three who works hard to support her family. She runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fruit. Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.

Eva is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  boxes of fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Determination and perseverance have been Marilyn’s guiding principles in running her business. She is now 51 years of age, married, and has seven children. Three of her children have settled in marriage, three are working, and the remaining one is attending school. 

Marilyn offers various vegetables and native cakes, within her locality. She has been running this kind of business for ten years up to now. At her age, she aims to have a stable source of income. In order to attain her goal in life, she is asking for additional capital of PHP5,000. She will use it to buy various kinds of vegetables, such as squash and string beans, and ingredients for making her native cakes. She hopes and prays that lenders will grant her requested loan amount, so she could sustain her family’s basic needs and have a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables, such as squash and string beans, and ingredients for making her native cakes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with six children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending and e-loading (mobile prepaid load credits).

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 28 years old and a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two daughters; both are studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard, and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For five years, Nazia has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all, she will repay the loan amount to Kiva, and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is much too congested. She hopes that her business grows more, and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

Lanie has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mirtha Gladys

texts.es:
Mirtha tiene 48 años, vive en al distrito de Subtanjalla al lado de su hijo, a quien quiere mucho y por quien se ha esforzado mucho para poder salir adelante, Mirtha trabaja como obrera de u fundo agrícola, en el cual labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Mirtha esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar una refrigeradora y de esta manera poder conservar mejor sus alimentos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 48 years old. She lives in the district of Subtanjalla with her son, whom she loves very much, and for whom she has worked hard to be successful. Mirtha works as an agricultural labourer for about 9 hours a day. She thinks things are going well for her because she is responsible. 

Mirtha is grateful for Kiva lenders. With their help she will be able to buy a refrigerator to preserve her food better. 

She will keep fighting for her dream to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 34 years old and single, with one child. 

She runs a small business selling cabbages, tomatoes, and peas in her community, and she has been doing this for many years. 

Rosalia has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seed and fertilizer and to pay her child's school fee. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Rosalia will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer and pay school fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married parent of four who works hard to support her family. She runs a tricycad tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns income from selling food. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Josephine is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her tricycad. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her tricycad

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns an income from selling bananas. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Jocelyn is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Marieta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Marieta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, chips, milk, noodles, etc., for her general store.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, chips, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 46 years old and married, with six children; three of her children are in school. 

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for 13 years now, and she has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice vending business.

Marilyn has been in this business for ten years.  She earns more income from  selling charcoal.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.en:
Zhibek is a first-year student at AUCA in the department of Business Administration. Here is her story.

“Choosing a university is an important and even the main step that can influence on your life and future. That is as important as a choice of profession. So to love your future job you must not make a mistake not only with the choice of profession but also with the choice of a proper university. I have dreamed about enrolling AUCA and I am happy that my dream came true. Of course the first reason is education. Nowadays education is the main facility for attainment of all your aims and becoming successful person in the future. If earlier the strongest person was one who had a weapon, now it is brain and acquired knowledge. I think that AUCA has all resources to give opportunity to get such high knowledge to students who try to get it. There is a wonderful library at AUCA. There is everything necessary for students. Another reason of my choice is a pleasant atmosphere and contingent. When you enter AUCA you immediately feel friendly spirit and desire of students to study. Among all the departments I chose business administration. Business will be required job whole over the world. Among all the above-mentioned opportunities AUCA provides financial aid to all its students, which is a Kiva loan. I would also like to take an opportunity and apply for Kiva loan. It will give me a great chance to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a kiva borrower and she is from a family of five. She has done a degree in Computer Science from a local university. She has been given a loan of KES 85,000 by SMEP DTM to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy so that she can gain skills and experience that will enable her get a job. She loves IT because of its ability to change the world and make a difference in peoples lives. She says that through IT, Kiva is a possibility. She hopes to be able to gain enough skills as an intern at NetHope Academy .

In 5 or 10 years she sees herself as a successful IT professional who participates in programs aimed at promoting training of IT amongst the disadvantaged in the community and hopefully become a techprenuer. 

She gets inspiration from her mother who sacrificed so much to help her achieve her goals and has always believed in her. She says that there are very few women doing computer science and her biggest challenge was the belief that women cannot do most of the technical stuff, but she is glad she managed to prove most of them wrong.

loans.use: pay fee for internship

loans.name: Isidro Rafael

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive don Isidro, tiene 47 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos,  uno ya es mayor de edad y el menor tiene 11 años y estudia en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Don Isidro es una persona muy querida y conocida en la localidad tanto es así que desde hace ya 4 años consiguió una concejalía en el cantón gracias a los votos de sus ciudadanos que al conocer lo buena persona que es lo eligieron para ocupar este puesto en el gobierno, él además de esta actividad también tiene su pequeño negocio el cual siempre le ha permitido salir adelante, tiene un local arrendado en el cual se dedica a vender empanadas de verde, pastelillos, corviches y muchos otros bocadillos que su mujer prepara, acompañados de gaseosas y jugos naturales.  Es así como el se ha ganado la vida trabajando honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, queso, pollos y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Dinámicas Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a city known for being very dynamic. The area has a lot of vegetation, so the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals.

Isidro, 47, lives here.  He's married and has two children from this relationship.  One is already grown and the younger one, 11, attends school.  His wife is a homemaker.

Isidro's a well-known and much-loved person in his town, so much so that four years ago he was elected councilman in his canton thanks to the citizens who recognized him as a good person to fill this government position.

He also has a small business that has always allowed him to get ahead.  He has a rented space where he sells plantain and other empanadas, corviche [a fish dish], and a lot of other snacks that his wife makes.  He also sells soda and natural juices.  This is how Isidro has earned an honest living.

This loan is to buy plantains, cheese, chicken, and other provisions necessary to prepare the dishes.

Isidro has been a member of the communal bank for three years and he likes it because of the help with loans.  His dream is to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cheese, chicken, and other provisions

loans.name: Maatane

texts.en:
Maatane is a 32-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She has a small business of 'elei' printing. She has many years with this business. Maatane needs a loan to buy 'elei' designs, rollers, brushes, fabric color paints, and other materials.

She will use her profits to improve her business. Maatane joined SPBD in 2010, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 'elei' designs, rollers, brushes, fabric color paints, and other materials

loans.name: Renaly

texts.en:
Renaly is 41 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Renaly has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising pigs. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans through NWTF.

Renaly is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of goods to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, soap, and other items. In the future, she aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, soap, and other items

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store and a pig-fattening businesses. 

Liza is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing.

Liza has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family.  She is married and she has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.

Rowena has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice grains to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to buy fam land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Athuman

texts.en:
Athuman lives in the Kongowea area north of Mombasa. He owns small retail business where he sells charcoal to the residents of Kongowea. Athuman has been doing this for more than a year now and his business is growing. He learned about Milango through friends who asked him to join so that he could access funds to expand his operations. Athuman's major business challenges include competition and transportation.

Athuman is requesting a loan to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to sell. He will use the income from his loan to improve his living standards. Athuman hopes that his business will expand to wholesale within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an intern at NetHope academy. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an IT internship at NetHope Academy.The internship will enable her gain skills and experience in information technology that will enable her get a job. She has always had a passion for IT; the fact that it is dynamic makes her want to learn more and achieve even more.

She enjoys dealing with challenges because they create room for innovation and creativity. In 5 or 10 years she sees herself being part of a technology city project. She feels that this will only be possible through the experience, training and mentorship from the NetHope Academy. Her thirst for knowledge enables her to achieve her goals. Knowledge is power, hence her key motivator. The need to know and learn makes her to strive to excel.

She faced a challenge of acquiring a laptop during her senior year project and to overcome this challenge, she decided to participate in a laptop project organized by a local mobile service provider and she was able to get a grant which catered for part of the laptop cost.

loans.use: to pay for internship program

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old. She has a degree in IT and describes herself as a highly motivated individual who is always striving to better herself and continually learn and gain knowledge.

She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 from SMEP DTM to pay for internship at NetHope Academy to enable her to gain skills and experience in IT that will enable her get a job. 

In 5 or 10 years time she hopes to be in a management position preferably in ICT sector and be a major decision maker. She feels that NetHope Academy will give her the required skills and experience to be successful in life. It has been a challenge trying to pursue her education goals and also making a living. She gets her inspiration from the late co-founder of Apple Inc Steve Jobs.

loans.use: pay for internship program

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 23 years old. He is the first born in a family of three. He has a degree in computer science. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him gain skills and experience in IT that will enable him get a job. He is always exited about new opportunities in ICT field that will enable him to gain knowledge to advance professionally.

In 5 or 10 years he wants to be a dynamic and competent IT professional who is able to provide effective solutions to problems in IT field. He also hopes to provide employment opportunities in the future. His desire to achieve more in IT motivates him. While pursuing his education, he faced a challenge of peer pressure to engage in irresponsible activities and was able to overcome by making realistic goals and focusing on them through out his academics.

loans.use: pay for internship program

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло живет в отдаленном регионе. Основным источником дохода для местных жителей является скотоводство. Рахматулло как и другие местные жители 1 год назад начал свой бизнес скотоводством. Ему 44 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Рахматулло и его жена стараются улучшить условию проживания. Однако у них маленький доход. Его жена предоставляет услуги швеи. Рахматулло хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Рахматулло запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет доброму человеку получить больше дохода и улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Rahmatullo lives in a remote region.  The main source of income for the local residents is cattle raising.  Like his neighbors, Rahmatullo started his own cattle business one year ago.  He is 44 years old, he is married and is raising three children.  Rahmatullo and his wife are trying to improve their living conditions, but they have only a small income.  His wife is working as a seamstress.  Rahmatullo wishes to increase his working capital and to attract more clients.  Rahmatullo is asking for a loan of 2,000 dollars (USD) to purchase additional cattle.  This loan will help a kind man to obtain income and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to increase his working capital

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional computer parts and supplies for her computer shop. This is also helpful for the education of her two children. Her business has been running for four years now. Her income from her business assisted in their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan to buy more computer parts and supplies for her shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luz dreams that her business will be successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship members in order to share stories of their lives and business.  She also draws strength from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from prepared-food vending and growing rice.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell, for her buy-and-sell rice grain business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and married with one kid. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past three years, Analyn has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising livestock. She has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Analyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 42 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school. For the past 18 years, Liezl has operated a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liezl is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising pigs.  

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain for her business.

Salvacion has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  saving money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additinal sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une femme de 43 ans veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 29 ans. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 10 ans. son activité fonctionne bien mais se pose souvent un problème de machine d'où la necessité de crédit qui lui permettra de s'acheter une nouvelle machine. celui ci l'aidera à honorer ses rendez vous de livraisons et augmenter ses commandes, mieux satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi augmenter ses bénéfices.  Bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Chantal, age 43, is a widowed mother of six children aged 16 to 29. After her training, she opened a small sewing shop in a district of the capital that she has been running for 10 years. Her business is doing well but she often has to deal with equipment problems, and this is why she needs a credit to buy a new sewing machine. This will help her to make her deliveries as scheduled, to bolster her orders, and to achieve customer satisfaction while boosting her profits. She will use part of these profits to invest in the expansion of her activity, and the remainder will allow her to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and update her workshop.

loans.name: Hasanjon

texts.ru: Хасанчону 56 лет. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Шахритус. Хасанчон знаком с деятельностью животноводства не понаслышке. Он имеет одну корову в своем хозяйстве. Ему нравиться проводить время на скотном дворе. Хасанчон хочет любимое занятие превратить в прибыльный бизнес. Он решил заниматься купле-продажей скота. Хасанчон будет разводить быков у себя во дворе, у него есть скотный двор и коровник, на зиму. На данный момент он имеет одну корову и 300 вязок кукурузной травы. Хасанчон берет кредит. Он надеется купить 4-х голов молодых бычков и их корм за счет кредита. Хасанчон верит в свою удачу и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Hasanjon is 56 years old.  Along with his family, he lives in Shahrituz.  Hasanjon is familiar with the work of cattle raising firsthand.  He has one cow in his household.  He likes to spend time in the barnyard.  Hasanjon wishes to transform his favorite activity into a profitable business.  He decided to start a business of cattle sales.  Hasanjon will be raising calves in his large barnyard during the winter.  Currently, he has one cow and 300 bales of cornstalks.  Hasanjon is asking for a loan to purchase four calves and some feed.  Hasanjon believes in his luck and in your support.

loans.use: To purchase four calves and some feed

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 24 years old. She is a very ambitious graduate who is very passionate about IT. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable her to gain experience and skills in IT that will enable her to get a job. She is ready to expand her IT knowledge in database administration and networking.

In 5 or 10 years she sees herself having more skills in IT and also having grown professionally. NetHope Academy will enable Jennifer to learn new skills in IT which will help her grow in her profession and become a database administrator. Her family inspires her to work hard to achieve her goals in life by encouraging her and offering all kinds of support when needed. While in college she faced a challenge of peer pressure but was able to overcome by setting goals for herself. She also had to overcome situations where people discouraged her but she was confident and always proved them wrong.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a kiva borrower aged 23 years old. He describes himself as a people person. He enjoys working and meeting a lot of different people. He also enjoys working to solve problems, troubleshooting issues and coming up with solutions in a timely manner.

In 5 or 10 years he sees himself as a top performing employee at a well established organization. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to enhance his skills and experience in IT which will enable him get a job. His passion for IT and community inspires him. Information technology offers him professional growth and it's resourceful and innovative.

Initially he had enrolled for accounting courses. After studying accounting for one year he realized that he was not passionate about accounting and he went to the career guidance and counseling centre, which directed him to his passion for IT.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 28 years old and he is from a humble background of a single parent. He has a passion for IT because it is a field where you learn everyday from challenges facing users. He has done a degree in computer engineering from a local university and has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for the internship program at NetHope Academy.

The internship will enable him gain skills and experience in IT which will enable him to get a job.

In the next 5 or 10 years he wants to start his own internet service provider company and become an employer. He also wants to grow and gain more knowledge and experience in the field of IT.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 23 years. Her passion for IT started way back when she was in primary school and she worked for grades that would enable her to study computer science. She has nurtured that passion and she is looking forward to getting more skills to enable her give back to the community and help organizations solve their problems through the use of IT. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable her ti gain skills and experience which will help her get a job.

In 5 or 10 years she sees herself as the best network administrator for a highly esteemed organization and ready to give back to the community by establishing a children's home and educating people, especially ladies so that they can value education and embrace information technology.

Her desire to succeed and help organizations and community solve problems through IT inspires her. In her first year and second year in university she didn't have a computer to practice programming and networking skills and she was able to overcome this challenge by convincing her relatives and parents to contribute some money to buy one.

loans.use: to pay for an internship  program

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman who runs a cafeteria in the village of Polanco, in Zamboanga del Norte. She has been cooking and selling food for more than six years, to earn a living.

She had joined GDMPC recently, and she borrowed a loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook. She always finds ways on how to please her customers. For example, she will personally prepare and cook their favorite menu. In the future, she wants to become successful in her business and plans to expand her shelter to give a comfortable ambiance to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Noreen Akhtar

texts.en:
Noreen is a 41-year-old hard working housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and two sons. Her husband is a electrician by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore from the past eight years, along with his electrician work, he also drives a taxi at night. 

But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Noreen has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to get a loan to repair the engine of her husband's taxi. 

With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. 

Noreen desires to provide a quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. 

She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the taxi.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German está muy agradecido con los financiadores de Kiva y espera continuar trabajando con recursos de esa entidad, porque con su anterior crédito, compró materiales para elaborar calzado y también artesanías que muy pronto vendió. Hoy tiene mas organización en su trabajo, no tiene deudas con prestamistas informales, que prestan dinero a altas tasas y se siente mas tranquilo, porque sus ingresos se incrementaron y sus utilidades las ha dirigido poco a poco a el mejoramiento de su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento el cual planea invertir en la compra de artesanías que tiene encargadas y necesita completar la adecuación de su vivienda. Su inversión proyecta ser exitosa porque justamente la hará en el momento en el que mas lo necesita, pues llega diciembre y con ello los pedidos de los clientes turistas, que rodean su negocio.
texts.en: German is very grateful to Kiva donors and hopes to continue working with resources provided by the organisation because, with his previous loan, he bought materials for making footwear and handicrafts which he sold very soon.  He now runs his business in a more organised way, has no debts with informal moneylenders who lend money at high rates, and feels relaxed because his income has risen and he has been able to gradually use his earnings to make improvements to his home.  He is now applying for a new loan which he plans to use to pay for handicrafts which he has on order and to finish repairs on his home.  His investment looks set to be successful because it will be made just when it is most needed - December is coming which means he can expect orders from the tourists who are around where he has his business.

loans.use: to pay for handicrafts which he has on order and to finish repairs to his home

loans.name: Susanie

texts.en:
Susanie is 42, married, and has two children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur; she has a fishing business in the Philippines. Susanie has been in this business for two years. 

Susanie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

In the future, Susanie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
This is Karen. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, for 19,000 PHP. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Karen dreams of giving her children a good life and education and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Señor Mario  trabaja como ayudante de carpinteria, vive en casa de unos familiares, en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para la apertura de un lugar de expendio de comida orureña; comprará maiz,charque (carne deshidratada especial para hacer plato típico de Oruro, papa y otros, de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Mario es poder reunir el suficiente dinero tener su restaurant propio.
texts.en:
Mario works as a carpenter's assistant and lives in the home of some relatives in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to open a place selling Orureñan food. He will buy corn, jerky (special dried meat for making a typical Oruro dish), potatoes and other items and in this way he will improve his income and his quality of life.

Mario's dream is to be able to get together enough money to have his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy corn, jerky, potatoes and other supplies for setting up a place selling typical food from the Oruro department.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from making dried fish.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish-vending business. Yvonne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 64 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as soap, milk, and sugar.

Josephine has been in this business for 49 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as soap, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora Lourdes   tiene una lavanderia, negocio del cual provienen sus ingresos. Vive en anticretico, en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de la Paz. Lourdes está casada y tiene tres hijos.
El crédito lo  requiere para la compra de una planchadora industrial y asi poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Lourdes es poder reunir el suficiente dinero tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lourdes has a launderette, which provides her with an income.  She lives in a rented house in the Pampahasi area of La Paz city.  Lourdes is married and has three children.

Lourdes needs this loan in order to buy an industrial iron so that can offer better service and thus increase her income.

Lourdes' dream is to be able to save up to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy an industrial iron for her launderette.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
La Señora Yanina   tiene una imprenta donde realiza todo pido de trabajos de imprenta como invitaciones, calendarios y otros. Vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz. Yanina tiene dos hijos que viven con ella.
El crédito lo  requiere para la compra de materia prima (papel, tinta y otros insumos), y de esta manera conseguir más contratos para poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Yanina es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para asi poder tener su casa propia.

esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Yanina has a print shop where she does all sorts of printing orders such as invitations, calendars and other items. She lives in her parents' house in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. Yanina has two children who live with her.

She needs the loan to buy materials (paper, ink and other supplies) and by doing this she will be able to take on more contracts so she can increase her income. 

Yanina's dream is to be able to get together enough money to have her own house. This is the second time she has taken a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and other supplies for her print shop.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda de 60 años, por las condiciones económicas en que creció no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela. Ella se dedica a la administración de una tienda en la playa. Vive con sus 2 hijos quienes le ayudan en el trabajo de la tienda; no obstante ellos ya no dependen de ella.

Ella posee una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad. El negocio ha sido su fuente  de ingreso por años y le gusta mucho; aporte de la tienda la señora y su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. Ella compra lo de la tienda en la ciudad, ubicada a 28 kilómetros. Otros productos lo dejan a domicilio. 

Hermenegilda, siempre ha  utilizado sus créditos como capital de trabajo, para su tienda cada 3 meses toma un crédito estacional para aumentar la mercadería en su negocio y al tener su negocio con distintos productos que vender sus ingresos aumentaran.


Sus aspiraciones, son poder lograr que su negocio siga siendo rentable en el tiempo y lograr que sus hijos conozcan a fondo la manera en que se administra, para en un futuro no muy lejano sean ellos los responsables de la misma.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is 60 years old and, because of her family's financial situation when she was a child, she was not able to attend school.  Hermenegilda has a shop on the beach.  She lives with her two children, who help her with the business.  However, the children are no longer dependent on their mother.

In Hermenegilda's shop, she sells staple goods.  The store has been a source of income for years and Hermenegilda likes it a lot. Hermenegilda brings in an income from the shop while her family makes a living buying and selling cattle.    Hermenegilda buys stock for the shop in the city, some 28 kilometres away.  Some products she has delivered to her home.

Hermenegilda has always used her loan as working capital.  She takes out a loan every three months in order to increase stock levels in her business.  With different products in her shop, Hermenegilda's income increases.

Hermenegilda's goals are to make her business profitable, and to make sure her children know everything there is to know about running her business.  That way, in the future, they can take over the running of the business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Pierre Clotaire

texts.fr: Pierre est un jeune homme de 35 ans célibataire, père d'un enfant âgé de 2 ans. Après sa formation, il aouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 9 ans déjà. Il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, appareils, et mobilier dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice.Il sollicite à nouveau un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs.
