Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en: Pierre, age 35, is a young, single father to a two-year-old child. After his professional training, he opened a hair salon which he has already been running for nine years. He often encounters problems due to a shortage of cosmetic products, equipment and furnishings in his salon because he buys everything retail. Hoping to achieve customer satisfaction and to earn substantial profits, he is seeking a new loan to buy his supplies in large quantities, which would allow him to meet his objectives. The profits earned through this loan will help him support himself and his family, and to save for a future expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy hair trimmers, cosmetic products and furniture.

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en: Haidilita is married and has two children. She and her husband operate their own farm to make a living. They have been farming for six years, and they earn enough for their daily living expenses. She has joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings. She is hopeful that with this investment, she will gain a better and an abundant return for the family. In the future, Haidilita wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, está surtiendo su inventario y necesita capital para adquirir madera por mayor para su carpintería y seguir trabajando para ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio y muebles de calidad. Con el crédito anterior trabajo sin dificultades, sus ganancias aumentaron, es por eso que se  ha decido continuar trabajando con préstamos.
Ofrece a su familia una alimentación diferente que antes por las circunstancias no lo podía hacer, su familia sigue integrada por el mismo número de miembros.
texts.en: Juan is stocking his business and needs capital to purchase wood wholesale for his carpentry shop. Then he can continue to work, offering his clients good service and quality furniture. He worked the last loan with no problems and his revenues increased. So he has decided to continue working with loans. He can now offer his family different food than before, as circumstances did not allow it. His family composition remains the same.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Delys

texts.es: Gracias por el apoyo recibido por parte de los finaciadores de Kiva, para que Delys tuviera en su salon de belleza, mayor oferta de articulos que mejoraron sus ventas porque compró en un mayor volumen mejorando el precio de compra y disminuyendo los gastos de transporte. Ella ahora quiere darle un toque de pintura a su sala de belleza, pues necesita tener cada vez mas una mejor presentación, para hacer de su local de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, un sitio placentero para sus clientes,tambien requiere hacer una nueva compra de insumos de belleza en un volumen superior, pues se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y con ello su negocio se ve impactado en sus ventas y utilidades, haciendo de esta inversión todo un éxito. Dice a sus finaciadores que está muy agradecida con el crédito y pide que sigan apoyando a muchas mas personas.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support she received from the lenders at Kiva, Delys was able to offer a greater selection of articles in her beauty salon which increased her sales. She was able to buy in larger volumes so the buying price and the cost of transportation were lower. 

Delys now wants to touch up her beauty salon with a bit of paint, as she wants an ever better appearance. She wants to make her business for improving your personal appearance a pleasant place for her clients. She also needs to make a new purchase of  beauty supplies in large volume. The festivals for the end of the year are approaching and her business is affected by greater sales and profits, making this investment a wise one. She'd like to say to her supporters that she is very grateful for the loan and asks that they continue supporting many other people.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, depilatory cream, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is widowed and has four children, four of whom attend school. She operates a charcoal selling business, which she has been doing for six years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Fatuma is requesting a loan from Yehu for 45,000 KES, which she will use to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es:
Felipe de 64 años, es agricultor desde pequeño, el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño el cultivo de la tierra.  ÉL no tiene estudio ya que menciona que en su tiempo de juventud no lo enviaban a estudiar, si no a trabajar .él vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, que  ya están casados y tiene sus familias 

Felipe cultiva la tierra desde pequeño y lo aprendió de su padre, quien le inculco valores de honrades y responsabilidad para el trabajo y de esa manera a sus hijos les inculco esos valores y también les enseño el trabajo y actualmente le ayuda un nieto al cultivar la tierra con granos básicos  

El préstamo lo utilizara, para el pago de la maquinaria que necesita,  para sacar el cultivo de maíz (desgranarlo y moler el guate)

Felipe desea, seguir trabajando hasta que pueda, enseñarle a su nieto que es, el que le ayuda el trabajo agrícola e inculcarle siempre valores de honestidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Felipe is 64 years old and has been a farmer since he was little. He has no education as he says that when he was a child they did not send him to school, only to work. He lives with his wife and their three children, who are now married and have families. 

Felipe has been cultivating the land since he was young and learnt this from his father, who instilled into him the value of honesty and responsibility towards the work, and in the same way Felipe has instilled these values into his own children and taught them how to do the work. Currently a grandson is helping him to cultivate the land with basic grains.

Felipe will use the loan to pay for the machinery he needs to process his corn crop (remove the kernels from the cob and mill the corn). Felipe wants to go on working for as long as he can and to teach the grandson who helps him in the agricultural work and always instil into him the value of honesty and responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for the machinery he needs to process his corn crop (remove the kernels from the cob and mill the corn).

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, está casada vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 22, 13 y 7 años. Es una mujer emprendedora que por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en la lucha constante de darles a sus hijos lo mejor, animada por sus amigas hace ya 20 años estableció su propia fuente de ingresos que consiste en venta de ropa y calzado. Atiende  de cinco de la mañana a cuatro dela tarde.
Con la inversión comprara ropa para ambos sexos, ropa interior y calzado, le permitirá estar preparada con variedad de productos para que sus clientes en estas épocas de graduaciones escolares puedan encontrar lo que están buscando.
Tener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, satisfacer a sus clientes, y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Marta is married and lives with her husband and her three children, aged 7, 13 and 22. She is an enterprising woman. Out of the necessity of helping her husband in the struggle to give their children the best and encouraged by her friends, she established her own source of income 20 years ago. She sells clothing and footwear. She works from 5 am until 4pm. 

Marta will use the loan to buy clothing for both sexes, underwear and footwear. This will allow her to be prepared with a variety of products so her clients in this season of school graduations, can find what they want. She will generate the income needed to support her children in their studies, help her husband with the household expenses and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy clothing for both sexes, underwear and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
María, se quedó sin capital para invertir y en las próximas fechas sabe que las ventas aumentan, por lo que se decidió a tomar un nuevo crédito e invertir en compra de leña, gas, azúcar,  aceite, maíz, etc., todo lo que sus clientes necesitan en sus hogares. El préstamo le sirvió para surtir su inventario, aumentar sus ventas, cancelar sus deudas.
Ya su hijo gracias al apoyo incondicional que le ha dado María, egreso de la universidad, y la sigue animando a mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
María lacked working capital to invest, and in recent days has became aware that sales are increasing, so she decided to take out a new loan and invest in the purchase of firewood, gas, sugar, cooking oil, corn, etc.–everything her customers need in their homes. 

The loan helped her to supply her inventory, increase her sales and pay off her debts. Now, thanks to the unconditional support that Maria has given him, her son has graduated from university and continues to encourage her to keep her business going.

loans.use: To buy firewood, gas, sugar, cooking oil, corn

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married and has one child. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish pond business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from the direct selling of Tupperware and personal collection products. 

Leonida is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feeds for her fish and shrimp. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her fish and shrimp

loans.name: Yamilet Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yamilet, cuanta con una familia compuesta por su compañero de vida, sus dos hijos y  ella, es una persona que a sus 36 años ha logrado establecer un negocio de venta de tortillas y comida en el centro de su ciudad, en sus inicios solo era una venta de tortillas en el patio de su casa, pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo, comenta que no le ha representa ningún problema para atenderlo.
Con el préstamo comprara 12 sacos de maíz, leña y una cocina de gas, que son necesarios para tener muy equipado su negocio, trabajar tranquilamente sin alguna limitante, aumentar su productividad, mejorar su economía.
Anhela cumplir con el compromiso de la deuda adquirida, ampliar su negocio, pero su prioridad más grande es darle a su hijos us estudios de medicina.
texts.en:
Yamilet has a family consisting of her life companion, her two children and herself. She is a 36 year old woman who has managed to establish a business selling tortillas and meals in the center of her city. In the beginning she just sold tortillas from the patio of her house and little by little her business has been growing. She comments that there are no problems running the business. 

With the loan Yamilet will buy 12 bags of corn, wood and a gas stove, which are necessary to keep her business well-equipped, work peacefully without hindrance, increase her productivity and improve her financial situation.  She hopes to be able to fulfill her obligations for this loan. Her greatest priority is to allow her children to study medicine.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of corn, wood and a gas stove.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es una madre soltera que vive con sus cuatro hijos, ella es el pilar principal de la familia, sobre sus hombros lleva toda la responsabilidad de generar ingresos para salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Su actividad económica es la crianza de cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos. Se le facilita estar pendiente de alimenta a los cerdo, ya que los tiene ubicados en su casa; para la siembra contrata mozos.
Comprará cerdos e insumos agrícolas, con lo que su negocio se verá fortalecido, dándole como resultado mejor producción, un negocio más amplio, y mejores ganancias.
Sueña mejor las condiciones familiares dándoles mejor alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos, cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas, para tener oportunidad de seguir trabajando con créditos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Teresa is a single mother who lives with her four children. She is the cornerstone of the family and shoulders all of the responsibility for generating income so she and her children can get on in life. Her business is rearing pigs and growing basic grains. It is easy for her to take care of feeding the pigs, since she keeps them at her home. She hires labourers for sowing the crops.

She will buy pigs and agricultural supplies, which will strengthen her business and as a result give her a better yield, a bigger business and better profits. She dreams of improving her family's living conditions, giving her children better food, health and education and paying off her loan instalments punctually so that she can have the opportunity of continuing to work with loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
This is Angeles. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will results in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angeles dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Lyn Lucelle

texts.en:
Maria Lyn Lucelle is a young entrepreneur of Polanco in Zamboanga del Norte. As an aid to her husband's income as OFW, she manages a buy and sell business selling newly harvested rice in volume in town. By doing this, for six years she was able to save an amount for the future needs of her children.

Maria borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit which she had recently joined to purchase more rice to sell. She is hopeful to sustain her business to earn more profit for the better living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments,  and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to purchase more raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Herlin Marilin

texts.es:
Herlin de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera quien vive junto a sus dos hijas y 2 nietos. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y a la venta de tamales, esto lo hace junto a sus hija mayor y la menor está estudiando y por las tardes le ayuda a ella, la señora solo estudio hasta el tercer grado.   

Herlin lleva más de 3 años de dedicarse al negocio de la venta de ropa y en la venta de tamales más de 10 años, el negocio de la venta de ropa, decidió emprenderlo,  ya que su hija trabajaba en una distribuidora de ropa y renuncio y convenció a su mamá para que se dedicaran a la venta de ropa casa por casa. 

El préstamo será utilizado,  para compra más mercadería (ropa)  para el negocio, ya que menciona que le ha ido bien y esta incursionando en la venta en lugares de Honduras, ya con este capital podrá surtir a los clientes que tiene y los que vaya generando. 

A futuro, planea tener un negocio fuerte, y que su hija y sus nietos salgan adelante en sus estudios académicos, que no les falte lo mínimo, y que puedan convertirse en todos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Herlin is 35 years old and is a single mother who lives with her two daughters and 2 grandchildren. She makes a living selling clothing and selling tamales, which she does with her older daughter. The younger daughter is studying and helps her in the afternoons. Herlin only studied as far as third grade. Herlin has been selling clothes for 3 years and tamales for more than 10 years.  She decided to start the clothing business since her daughter used to work for a clothing distributor and when she stopped doing this she convinced her mum to make a living selling clothing door-to-door.

The loan will be used to buy more merchandise (clothing) for the business, since Herlin says it has gone well for her and she is venturing into selling in places in Honduras. With this capital she will be able to supply the customers she has already and also new ones which she will attract. In the future she plans to have a strong business. She wants her daughter and grandchildren to make good progress in their academic studies, not to want for anything, and to all become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothing) for the business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married, with nine children.  Five attend school, and four are adults, but all are the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Kwekwe has operated a cafe business making constables like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, está soltero, vive con su mamá y su sobrino de 14 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar aprendió de su madre a vender ropa, desde hace un tiempo se independizo con su propio negocio en el que ofrece a sus clientes ropa nueva, usada y calzado. Atiende de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., este horario varía según estén las ventas.
Comprará vestidos, faldas, calzado y ropa usada, con el fin de estar preparado para la época navideña, pues es en estas fechas que las ventas aumentan y sus ingresos serán mayores con los que cancelara sus deudas, apoyara con los gastos a su mamá.
Sueña con tener su propia casa, seguir a  poyando a su familia, aumentar sus clientes, un negocio más amplio y muy rentable.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and lives with his mother and 14-year old nephew.  Because he needed to generate some income to cover the household expenses, his mother taught him to sell clothing.  Some time ago, Miguel went out on his own.  He sells his customers new and second-hand clothing and footwear.  Miguel works from 7:00a.m. to 4:00p.m., but his schedule varies according to his sales. 
Miguel will purchase dresses, skirts, footwear and second-hand clothing to prepare for the Christmas season.  During the Christmas season, his sales go up and his income will too as people pay off their debts to him.  This will help him to help his mother with their expenses. 
Miguel dreams of having his own house, continuing to help his family financially and increasing his customer base.  He wants his business to expand and to be very profitable.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, skirts, footwear and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Shamir

texts.en:
Shamir lives in the village of Khachardzan, which is in the region of Tavush. 

Shamir has a big family and a large farm. He is married, with four children; three daughters and son.  They all live in a nice big house with Shamir’s retired grandfather. Shamir’s wife does not work; she takes care of their big family. 

For several years Shamir worked as a bricklayer, but now he provides for his family only through the income he earns from farming and agriculture. In his farm he has four cows, eight piglets, 20 chickens, and five beehives. He also has a plot of land which is an orchard, where he has apple, peach, and plum trees. 

Shamir sells meat, honey, dairy products, beans, apples, and plums to his neighbors and re-sellers.  Near the period of Christmas and New Year, Shamir always perfectly manages to sell pork.  This year he hopes he will have a good sale near at the end of the year.

He asks a loan of AMD 500,000 in order to buy a lot of fodder for his pigs so he can show the buyers that his farm pigs are perfectly cared for, rotund, and meaty.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his pigs to be able to show buyers that his farm pigs are perfectly cared for, rotund, and meaty

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a single entrepreneur who runs a sari sari store and a video-k entertainment business at Olingan in Dipolog City. She has been doing this business for three years to earn a living. 

She borrowed from GDMPC microcredit to purchase a new microphone and pay maintenance costs in order to entertain her customers and be able to offer better service. 

She wants to improve her business and to sustain it for the future needs of her child.

loans.use: to purchase a new microphone and pay maintenance costs

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married, with six children, five of whom attend school, and one is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Teresa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy another fishing net.

Teresa has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 35 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales ayudan a su madre en las diferentes actividades que se desarrollan en el campo como ser: limpieza, corte, abono, Fumigación, etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Ella se dedica al comercio vende comida y también vende piña de manera que también la cultiva dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace un año en la que solo ella y sus hijos se involucran ya que su esposo vive en EE.UU desde hace un tiempo el cual apoya mediante él envió de remesas a sus hijos y su esposa. 
Día a día es en compañía de sus hijos que lucha para salir adelante dividiéndose el trabajo por lo que hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que ayudaran a que sus cultivos de piña con los que protegerá de plagas y otros que dañen la producción
Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de piña pero también poder sembrar café dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma pueda generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar y fortalecer la economía en su hogar y el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is 35 years old, is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She is married and she and her husband have 3 children who help their mother in the various tasks which need doing in the field such as weeding, pruning, applying fertilizer, fumigation, etc. Elizabeth has completed her primary education up to 6th grade and was unable to continue with her education because of a lack of financial support from her parents. She makes a living selling food and pineapple, which she also grows. She has been doing this for a year and she and her children do this work on their own since her husband has lived in the US for some time. He supports them by sending money to his wife and children. Elizabeth works hard with her children on a daily basis to get on in life, dividing the work up between them.

This is why she is now asking for help to buy manure, fertilizers and other supplies which will help to protect her pineapple plants from insects and other problems which can damage the crop.

Her plans for the future are to have a bigger pineapple plantation but also to grow coffee so she can give variety to her customers and everyone who consumes her produce so that she can generate more income which will eventually strengthen her household finances and the assets for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to protect her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a poor but hardworking woman. She is 39 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. The living standard of her family members is not good, so she wants to change the living standard of her family and provide them with better education. 

Razia's husband conducts a business in which he provides sheltering services for under-constructed houses. Earlier he did this as a member of a group which provided sheltering services; now, he has started his own business of providing sheltering services. 

To enhance his business and to provide better services, he wants to buy more sheltering material such as planks, nails, wooden boards and bamboo. For this purpose Razia has requested a loan. This will enable her husband to invest more money in his current business. She hopes that with this loan amount her husband will be able to buy pillars and wooden boards, and as a result, generate more profit.

Razia praises and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy planks, nails, wooden boards and bamboo for her husband to provide sheltering services.

loans.name: Argishti

texts.en:
Argishti is 23 years old, and he lives in Vnadzor city, which is in the Lori region. 

Argishti is very purposeful and a brave young man.  The specialty that he works now is very risky and even dangerous for his life, but he is not afraid of anything. He is a policeman and works at the Police Station in Vanadzor city. 

At the same time he studies at the Vanadzor Pedagogical Institute at the faculty of Jurisprudence. He is doing distance learning. 

Argishti lives with his mother and school-aged brother. His father temporally is in the Russian Federation as a guest worker, and from time to time financially he provides for his family. 

Argishti asks a loan of AMD 600,000 in order to do some repairs in their flat and make his family's living conditions better and more comfortable.

loans.use: to do some repairrsin his flat and make his family's living conditions more comfortable

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela, por la responsabilidad que implica sacar adelante sola a sus hijos puso en práctica lo aprendido de su madre y emprendió un negocio de venta de tortillas, con el tiempo una de sus amigas le enseño a preparar meriendas, es así como ofrece más productos a sus clientes, labora todos los días, sin ningún problema.
Con la inversión comprara maíz, leña, bolsas, papel, que son su materia prima para trabajar, espera tener un negocio rentable, atraer a más clientes, cancelar el crédito adecuadamente.
Sueña con tener su casa propia para disfrutar de sus hijos, dales mejor alimentación, salud y una educación que les dé la oportunidad de ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Yanira is the single mother of four children, two of whom are students. Being solely responsible for supporting her children, she put into practice what she learned from her mother and started a business selling tortillas. A friend taught her how to make appetizers and offer more items to her customers. She works every day without a problem.

She will use the loan to buy corn, wood, bags, and paper, which are her basic business supplies. She hopes to have a profitable business, attract more customers, and pay off her loan. She dreams of having her own house to share with her children and of giving them better nutrition, health, and an education that offers them the chance to have a career.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, bags, and paper.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband carries goods from one place to another on a donkey cart. He wants to use a mule instead of a donkey because a mule can pull more goods than a donkey.With a mule, he can easily carry more goods in a short time, which will result in saving time and increasing income.

Parveen is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy a mule for his business. She wants to save the excess profits for the future's sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a mule

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is married, with four children.  

Mario makes furrniture.  He is an entrepreneur from Obay, Polanco, in Zamboanga del Norte. He has been in his business for more than a year, and he earns a good living. 

He joined GDMPC recently, and he has borrowed a loan to buy raw materials like wood and varnish and paints. 

He wants to improve and expand his business and be able to gain more returns for a better living for his entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, like wood and varnish and paints

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
With her previous loan, Susan was able to buy the products and ingredients for her food stall, which she has been operating for seven years. The loan  also helped in the education of her children while the income from her business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family. She also has a computer shop for additional income.

Susan is requesting another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken,  vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits will help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. Susan hopes to be more successful in business and to have her own vehicle. 

Susan meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta works hard to support her family. Mamerta is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Mamerta requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Mamerta has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has three children who attend school.  For the past four years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces the challenges of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan from Yehu for.50,0000 KES, which she will use to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She hopes to buy a new motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es una mujer joven con 29 años de edad, casada, ama de casa y agricultora que desde muy joven fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol. Ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Florentina tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo de café en compañía de su esposo ya que en la zona donde ellos viven el café se cultiva fácilmente ya que la tierra es fértil y el clima es apto para esta clase de grano. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo cultivan es propio gracias a una compra que le hicieron a uno de sus clientes hace algún tiempo el cual está ubicado a 10 minutos de camino y algunas ocasiones se traslada a en bestia ya que al momento de la recolección del grano solo ella y su esposo se involucran.
Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café como una mayor limpieza, fertilización, abono, entre otros que darán mejores resultados al final de la cosecha.
sus planes son los de poder cultivar 1500 nuevas plantillas de café con los que podrá extender más sus cultivos y que gracias a la posible compra de insumos que ella realizara podrá también asistirlos de manera que la planta desde su cultivo este bien protegida y asistida. Como madre ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados a nivel universitario, en un mejor estilo de vida, y con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Florentina, 29, is married, a housewife, and a farmer. At an early age, her parents taught her to work the land where they grew coffee, corn, and beans. She is the mother of four children who attend a local school. Florentina has garnered much experience in the 10 years she has been growing coffee along with her husband, as coffee grows well in the area where they live because the soil is fertile and the climate is good for this crop. She and her husband own the land they cultivate, thanks to the purchase they made from one of their customers a while ago. The land is a 10-minute walk away, and sometimes they bring an animal because they collect the coffee grains by themselves.

She has applied to the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan to better care for their coffee crop by clearing, fertilizing, and doing other tasks that will yield a better harvest. She plans to expand her crop and cultivate 1500 new coffee plants. By purchasing supplies, she will also be able to ensure that the plants are well tended and protected. As a mother, she dreams of seeing her children graduate from college and of having a higher standard of living and brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow 1500 coffee plants.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar is 57 years old and married. 

She has been running a vegetable shop for the past ten years. She has gotten a lot of appreciation through her work. She is hard-working. People prefer her for fresh vegetables. She makes enough to support her family well.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of BRAC Pakistan and has been in association with BRAC for two years. 

Due to an increase in the number of customers, she requires another vegetable shop, to cater to many customers at a time. For this, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to meet the requirements of her shop, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. 

Parveen desires to expand her vegetable shop and intends to spend part of the income on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to expand her vegetable shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Daisy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 21 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

Janice is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janice has been farming rice for 2 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sayda Raquel

texts.es:
Sayda vive en la ciudad de Camaná, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa con el cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante, Sayda cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Sayda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería como polos, short, bividis, entre otros; de esta manera podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en: Sayda lives in the city of Camaná and has a small business selling clothing from which she earns money to live. Sayda says that things are going well because she is very friendly, and, above all, responsible. Sayda thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will let her buy merchandise like polos, shorts, and camisoles so that she can better serve her clients, earn more, and keep working to achieve her great dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotun, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde se dedica a la venta de ropa damas, caballeros y niños, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa de temporada y poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes, con esto generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: 52-year old Eloisa lives with her husband in the district of Oyotun, two hours from the town of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region. She runs a small store selling clothing for men, women, and children as well as beauty products. Eloisa is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy clothing appropriate for the season to offer to her customers. In this way she will earn more money to support her family

loans.use: To buy  clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 65 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries for land preparation.

Lolita has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries for land preparation.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura works hard to support her family. Maura is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maura requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Maura has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 32 years old and has three children who are in school. She works hard to support her family by running a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle. Merly has been in this business for eight years, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Norsia

texts.en:
Norsia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetable and spice business.

Norsia has been in this business for 10 years. Norsia earns additional income from farming rice.

Norsia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Martha Mirian

texts.es:
Martha de 29 años, estudio hasta noveno grado, ella es casada; su esposo se dedica a los  trabajos de  la albañilería, ellos solo tienen un hijo que vive con ellos de 5 años de edad y actualmente está estudiando kínder.

Martha se dedica a los oficios domésticos como empleada doméstica, ella dice que desde que estaba pequeña realizaba oficios domésticos y su mamá la ponía a realizar los oficios domésticos. Ella aparte de realizar los oficios domésticos, también tiene un molino de maíz que le genera ingresos económicos extra a su familia. De su familia solo ella se dedica a esta actividad, el horario que ella tiene no es estable y para ir a su lugar de trabajo, tiene que abordar un bus durante 15 minutos a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa al trabajo, el horario de trabajo que realiza es de 7am a 3 de la tarde.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para instalar una pequeña granja de pollos, pues ella ha visto que es una actividad que genera buenos ingresos; específicamente comprara, 100 pollos y alimento concentrado para pollos, con el pequeño proyecto de producción de pollos de engorde le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos para su familia, lo de la granja era un deseo que tenían con su esposo desde hace tiempos y por fin se les hiso realidad de tener su propia granja por medio del crédito 

Martha desea para el futuro tener una granja más grande y una mayor producción de pollos y también  tener un mejor empleo para ella y su esposo y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijo y que su hijo siga estudiando para que en el futuro sea profesional y logre sacar  una carrera universitaria, todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposo.
texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and has studied as far as ninth grade. She is married and her husband works as a bricklayer. They have just one 5-year-old son who lives with them and is currently at kindergarten.

Martha earns a living as a domestic help. She says that ever since she was little she used to do jobs around the house and her mother sent her to do domestic work. Apart from her job as a domestic help, she has a corn mill which brings in extra income for the family. She is the only one in the family who does this work and this does not have fixed hours. To get to work she takes a 15 min bus ride to go the 3 km from her house, and her working hours are from 7am to 3pm. 

The loan Martha is asking for is to set up a small poultry farm, since she has seen that this is a business which gives a good income. Specifically, she will buy 100 chickens and concentrated chicken feed. With this small project of producing fattened chickens she will be able to make more income for her family. The idea of a chicken farm is something which she and her husband have had for some time and at last having their own chicken farm has become a reality thanks to the loan.

In the future Martha wants to have a bigger farm and a larger chicken production and better employment for herself and her husband and to live comfortably in a decent place with their son. She wants her son to continue with his education so that in the future he can become a professional and go to university. She and her husband will achieve this with a great deal of hard work and commitment.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and concentrated chicken feed.

loans.name: Nazlim

texts.en:
Nazlim is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widowed woman. She has six children, one of whom attends school. The rest are adults. Dzame owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Dzame operates a goat meat selling business. She supplies goat meat to butcheries and hotels. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. The other two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, Masika wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Oneyda Elizabet

texts.es:
Oneyda es una mujer de 40 años de edad la cual es licenciada en educación básica en grado asociado, casada y en compañía de sus esposo se dedica a la a agricultura en lo que es cultivo de café que de su matrimonio tienen 2 hijos uno de 15 años que está en tercero de ciclo común y una hija de 20 años que ya se graduó de bachiller en ciencias y letras. Su fuerte es el cultivo de café ya que desde hace más de 2 años aprendió a trabajar en este rubro gracias siendo su esposo quien la instruyera y le enseñara las diferentes actividades para que sus cultivos de café se mantengan sanos y protegidos ya que él ha sido agricultor de siempre. La tierra que ellos trabajan la adquirieron por medio de la compra encontrando como desafíos la baja de precios en el café y las escasas lluvias (factor clima). Ella considera que en este rubro la competencia no es factor problema ya que sus clientes están definidos. Su área de cultivo está a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en autobús.
Sus planes como agricultora es seguir invirtiendo en su cultivo de café para que sus áreas sea más productivas cada año y así poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia. Como madre brindar a sus hijos las mejores oportunidades de estudio para que ellos puedan convertirse en personas profesionales y altamente calificadas.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que son necesarios para el mantenimiento del café ya que en esta temporada sus expectativas son muchas mejorando sus ingresos ya que será favorable para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Oneyda is a 40-year-old woman with a associate's degree in elementary education. She is married and together with her husband makes a living from agriculture by growing coffee. They have 2 children, one 15 years old in the third year of junior high school, and a 20-year-old daughter who graduated from high school in science and literature.

Oneyda is good at coffee growing since she learned how to do it more than two years ago. Her husband instructed her and taught her all the different activities that need to be undertaken to keep her coffee plants healthy and protected. He has always been a farmer.

They bought the land that they work, finding challenges such as the decrease of coffee prices and the scarce rain a (weather factor). She considers that in this field competition is not a problematic factor since they have well-defined customers. Her coffee farm is 3 kilometres away from her house, so she gets there by bus.

Her plan as a farmer is to keep investing in her coffee farm to make her plants more productive every year, and so to earn a better income for her family. As a mother she wants to provide her children better study opportunities so that they can become professional and highly qualified people.

She is therefore now requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilisers and other supplies which are necessary for the maintenance of the coffee plants. She expects her income to improve, which will be favourable to keep working.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crop

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35 years old, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a PCO (public call office) for many years and earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots the mobiles as well; he wants to sell mobile accessories, such as chargers, bodies, and data cable, also.

Nowadays demand for mobile accessories has increased, so sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest in his business because he has spent all his income on household expenses. 

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy additional mobile accessories. 

Shakeela thanks Kiva and its field partner over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for her husband to sell

loans.name: Nelfe

texts.en:
Nelfe helps her husband, who is a fisherman, to earn a living. She sells fish in their community and it helps to provide for their daily needs. 

Nelfe borrowed from GDMPC to purchase fishing nets. Her dream is to send her only child to school to finish studies for a good future. 

Nelfe wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and the mother of six children who runs a general store to make a living and meet her family's daily needs. She always finds ways to improve her business and has requested a loan from GDMPC to buy additional goods to sell. She hopes that in the future, one of her children will graduate from school and help sustain the education of the others.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Milagro

texts.es:
María del Milagro tiene 35 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en Cayalti, en una zona donde su población se decía al comercio de animales menores. Cultivos de maíz, caña a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Su esposo se dedica a la labor de servicio de yunta, preparando la tierra para los cultivos, sus hijos lo apoyan en esta labor María del Milagro ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un caballo para transportar productos agrícolas y de esta manera incrementar otro servicio, generándole mayores utilidades para su familia.
texts.en: María del Milagro, 35, lives with her husband in Cayalti, where the residents raise small livestock and grow corn and cane. It is about two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region along the north coast of Peru. Her husband and her children offer the service of tilling land for planting. María del Milagro has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy a horse to offer another service, transporting farm products, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a horse to offer transportation for farm products.

loans.name: Jesus Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús del Carmen tiene 26 años de edad vive junto a sus padres en el distrtito de Pucará, esta comunidad se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, cultivos de frutales destacando las producción de piñas.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de raspadillas y jugos, Ella es una mujer emprendedora y ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de un molino de hielo que le ayudara a producir un mayor número de raspadillas y así aumentar sus ventas.

Jesús del Carmen nos explica que con las ganancias que obtenga de la venta de rapadillas va ayudar a contribuir con el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
26-year old Jesús del Carmen lives with her parents in Pucará, a district known for its hot climate and its fruit, especially pineapples. For three years she has earned her living selling iced drinks and juices. A hardworking woman, Jesús is seeking a loan of 800 soles to buy an ice-grinding machine which will help her produce an increased quantity of drinks and make more sales.

Jesús notes that the money she earns from these sales will help her contribute to the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: Buy an ice-grinding machine

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias 35 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona productora de arroz, yuca, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El nos explica que brinda servicios de albañilería, es muy conocido por las labores que realiza, y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para adquirir herramientas nuevas y con eso seguir brindando un servicio eficiente.

Elias confía en Edpyme Alternativa, anteriormente solicito un préstamo con el que compro parte de sus herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elias, 35 years old, lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, a rice and yucca producing zone two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides bricklaying services, and is very well known for the work he does.  He has applied for a loan of 1,000 nuevo soles to purchase new tools and with these, continue providing efficient service.

Elias trusts Edpyme Alternativa.  He previously applied for a loan, with which he bought part of his work tools.

loans.use: to buy molding tools.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy new wheels and maintain the rickshaw's engine. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Noreen gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married, with four children, two of whom attend school and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major business challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en: Raida is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.en:
Nurzada is a first-year student of AUCA, department of Economics. Here is her story: 

“I have dreamed about studying at a university with the best professors and all opportunities for students. The person who influenced me was my teacher of English. She taught me not only the skills to communicate, read and write in English, but also to be honest, kind and responsible. I decided to enter AUCA and am very happy to become part of it now. AUCA is the best university and has a high reputation in our country. 

My mathematics background will give me an opportunity to be one of the best students, as the lyceum where I studied is one of the leading schools, and it produces students who are skilled in maths. Therefore I entered the Economics department.

Amongst other opportunities, AUCA provides financial aid to all its students, through Kiva loans. I would also like to take the opportunity and apply for Kiva loan. It will give me a great ability to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 45 años de edad, vive en Buenos Aires una comunidad pequeña, con abundantes bosque secos de algarrobos, su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores, cultivo de arroz, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado en la región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de leña para braseros, adicionalmente carga hormigón material utilizado en las zonas rurales para la construcción de viviendas, Carlos ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para mejorar la construcción de una pared de su vivienda, con el crédito otorgado podrá tener un ambiente seguro para residir.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old and lives in Buenas Aires, a small community with many carob trees. It is part of Morropon, located in the region of Piura on Peru's north coast. The local people raise animals and grow rice.

Carlos earns his living selling firewood for braziers and cement which is used in the rural areas for building houses. He is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to improve a wall in his house. This will make his home much safer.

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 51 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city which is in the Lori region. Susanna is married and she has a son, who temporarily lives and works in the republic of Nagorno Karabakh. He is in the conventional military, and at the same time, he studies at the paid division of Yerevan Economical Academy in his last year of the distance learning division. 

Susanna and her husband, who is now in Russian Federation and does construction work, work very hard in order to help their son to pay for his education. Despite her son's savings, they are again short of money and it is already the time to pay for his first semester tuition fee.

Susanna asks a loan of 160,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her son's tuition fee. They really need this money and hope for support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en: Zaitun appreciates the assistance she received with a previous Kiva loan because it improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a new loan for KSH. 30,000 to buy ingredients such as maize flour and wheat flour to use in her business. She also wishes to thank Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as maize and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат и пока не имеет детей. Он живёт со своей женой в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Дилмурода домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая жена. Сам Дилмурод работает плотником. Он принимает заказы и работает у себя дома. От этого дела Дилмурод получает хороший доход. Но этого дохода хватает ему только на пропитание. Но у него есть мечта, Дилмурод хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи, так как скоро у него появятся дети и нужно будет много места для его семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. Того, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Дилмурод обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Дилмурод и его жена очень надеются на положительный результат и заранее благодарят Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a positive and responsible 29 year-old man.  He is married and does not yet have children.  He lives with his wife in a small village.  The house where they live is small and not quite suited for a good living in it.  Dilmurod's wife is a homemaker; she is a very hardworking and caring wife.  Dilmurod works as a carpenter.  He takes orders and works at home.  Dilmurod earns a goods income from this business, but the income is only enough for food expenses.  But he has a dream.  Dilmurod wants to build a big house for his family because he will soon have children and will need more space for his family.  He needs money for this.  What he earns is not enough to allow him to build a new house.  This is why Dilmurod came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials for building a house.  Dilmurod and his wife hope very much for a positive result and thank Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house

loans.name: Vano

texts.en: Vano is 27 years old and lives in Tbilisi city with his wife Miranda. Miranda is a university attendant who hopes to get a higher education. Vano runs a new store at the local open market where he sells building materials. He started the store a month ago and the business is doing well but it needs support to develop. That is why Vano is applying for a loan to buy more construction materials to sell in his store and increase his income. He hopes to attract more customers and earn additional income for his new family. Vano will pay for his wife’s tuition and the couple is working hard to be able to improve their future standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials to resell.

loans.name: Miniva

texts.en:
Miniva, 48, is a farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia and mother of eight children. She is asking for a Kiva loan to obtain a water pump that will help her irrigate and expand her vegetable garden.

For the past 5 years, Miniva has been drawing water for her garden from a nearby stream with buckets.  It’s a very tiring task, especially during the dry season when she has to water her fresh greens and okra on a daily basis. Despite this, she has managed to maintain a healthy garden, and has been selling her crops at a roadside market. 

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Miniva, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once she secures a loan, Miniva will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Miniva hopes the water pump will allow her to double her production next season, enabling her to better support her family by investing in animals and paying school fees for her children. It is for this reason Miniva is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with this loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is married and has an only child. She manages her own cafeteria, to earn a living. She has been running this business for more than two years. She joined GDMPC recently, and she gained access to micro-finance services. She has borrowed a loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to build her own restaurant, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for the cooked foods she will sell

loans.name: Ellen Faith

texts.en: Ellen Faith dreams of becoming a teacher. She is currently attending Stella Maris College for her BS degree in education. Ellen is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase textbooks, school materials, and uniforms. She wants to finish her studies and have a job in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school materials, books, and uniforms

loans.name: Dang

texts.en:
Dang was born in 1993; he lives in Bac Ninh province. 

He is a plant breeding major at Hanoi Agricultural University. His course lasts 40 months, and he will graduate in September, 2016. His educational fee is subsidized by his parent; his mother is in the photo with him.  

Dang’s family has five members. His parents are farmers and cattle raisers, and he has a brother and a sister. He is his parents’ youngest son. He is the only person in his family who has a higher education. His family’s income is about 15,000,000VND per month. 

Dang thinks the major he is pursuing is the most suitable for him because after this course, he will have the knowledge and opportunities to find a job in his hometown. 

He wants to borrow 10,098,000 VND to pay his educational fees. 

In addition to lacking educational fees, he has other difficulties such as his living expenses and transportation fees. If he couldn’t access to this loan, his studying would be interrupted. 

He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has contributed a lot to the education of students in Vietnam. 

He also hopes that this program could be expanded to help more students.

loans.use: to pay for his educational fees.

loans.name: Ndurya

texts.en: Ndurya lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 29 years of age and a married businessman. He runs a motorcycle transport business, and it has been operating for the last three years. He knew about Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. This business is the only income generator for him. The major challenges that he faces in the business are the competition from other operators, and the weather. He will use the income that he will earn, to improve his standard of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer from Chibombo District in Central Province, Zambia where he grows cabbage and a local eggplant called “Impwa”. Currently he irrigates his garden by hand, drawing water from a nearby stream with buckets. It’s a tiring task, and limits Charles’ ability to expand. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a water pump that will allow him to irrigate and expand his fields.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Charles, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Charles will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a water pump Charles plans to greatly expand his production to meet local demand and even begin to transport his crops to larger markets in Lusaka where he can fetch a higher price. He hopes to invest his new profits in animals and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Danwell

texts.en:
Danwell is a farmer and father of seven children from Chibombo District, Zambia. Currently he produces tomatoes and a local eggplant called “Impwa” to sell at a local market and at a major market in Lusaka, the capital city. Using buckets to draw water from a nearby stream, he has been able to maintain his garden, even during the dry season. This is a tiring task however, and limits his ability to further expand and increase his income. It is for this reason he is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can obtain a water pump.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Danwell, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Danwell will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Danwell plans to use the water pump to significantly expand his production. He hopes to use the profits to assist him in building a new house for his family.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Loti

texts.en:
Loti, 28, has four children and is a farmer in Nyimba District, Eastern Province, Zambia. He currently grows cabbage, fresh greens and tomatoes to sell at local markets. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump for irrigation.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers in Eastern Province such as Loti, who often struggle to irrigate their crops due to irregular rains. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Loti will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Loti hopes that this new pump will allow him to significantly increase the area he can cultivate, especially for cabbage. It is for this reason he is asking for a Kiva loan so he can obtain a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Ronilyn

texts.en:
Ronilyn is married, with four children.  She runs a general store as an aid to her husband's income from employment to make a living.  

She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed money to buy additional grocery goods for sale. From her revenue, she saved a portion for the education of her children, and she used the rest for their daily needs and capital. 

Ronilyn hopes to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Mwangona

texts.en:
Mwagona lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man with two children. He operates a retail shop that has been in existence for the past five years. His business has grown over the years, and he has been able to employ two people to help him run the business. He has ambitions of growing the retail shop into a wholesale business in the next five years, despite the challenges of competition and theft.

He knew about Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy paraffin and other retail products for the business. He will use the income that he will earn, to improve his standard of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy paraffin products to sell at his retail shop

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Edwin, a farmer living in Kitale. He has been a farmer for about six years, raising dairy cows and poultry. He also grows crops, which he sells in the local market. He loves milking his dairy cows and selling the milk, to get a better profit. His major challenge is getting feed for his livestock.

Edwin chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund his loan, because he wanted to purchase a dairy cow, and Juhudi Kilimo offers its loans at lower interest rates. This loan will benefit his family, in that more income will be generated due to the increase in milk production. During the Juhudi Kilimo training, he learned that it's important to develop a culture of saving.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Maryuri Eliett

texts.es:
Maryuri Eliett es una joven Sauceña de 24 años que estudia la carrera de Desarrollo Social, su negocio consiste en una tienda de ropa y zapatos donde ofrece estos productos para damas, caballeros y niños.
Este negocio lo inició hace cuatro años con capital que le regaló su abuelita para que se dedicara a su propio negocio y costeara sus estudios, ya que fue criada por ella.
Maryuri lo ubicó en su vivienda donde tiene la ventaja que habita en un barrio central en el municipio de El Sauce.
Se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con fondos Kiva para invertir en dicho negocio y comprar pantalones de varón, pantalones de mujer, ropa interior, capri y blusas, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña la cual es muy buena donde sus clientes buscan ropa nueva y zapatos para estrenar en esa época y no cuenta con capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda del mercado.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para poder llevar a cabo su inversión donde estará muy agradecida por este apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Maryuri Eliett is a young, 24-year old "Sauceña" [from El Sauce] who is studying Social Development.  Her business consists of a clothing and shoe store, where she offers these products for ladies, gentlemen and children.

She started this business four years ago with capital that her grandmother, who raised her, gave her so that she could start her own business and finance her studies.  Maryuri started her shop at her home, because she has the advantage of living in a central neighborhood in the municipality of El Sauce.

She went to the office of Ceprodel in search of financing from Kiva to invest in this business and to buy men's pants, women's pants, underwear, capris and blouses.  The Christmas season is approaching, when her customers come looking for new clothes and shoes to wear during the season, and she does not have enough capital to satisfy market demand.

She hopes and trusts in God that these good-hearted people will support her application so that she can see her investment through.  She will be very grateful for this unconditional support.

loans.use: to buy men's pants, women's pants, underwear, capris and blouses.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en: Mia's dream is to work as a public accountant. To achieve her goal, Mia has enrolled in the BS - Accountancy program at Stella Maris College. With the requested loan, Mia will pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. Her father is government employee and her mother is a housekeeper. With four siblings, attending college is not easy. Mia is unsure of how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a GDMPC education loan.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Semy

texts.en:
Semy is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Semy earns more income by buying fish from others, to sell.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, like wood and bamboo.

Semy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, like wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is married and has one child who is in the military service. He is an experienced farmer from Vanadzor city of Lori region. His wife works at a school as a teacher. Samvel is engaged in breeding livestock such as pigs, piglets, and hens. He sells his livestock in the local market. He and his wife work hard to be able to cover their needs. 

Agribusiness is the main source of family's income. To continue running it in a sustainable way, Samvel is requesting a loan for $3,000, which he will use to purchase some forage for the livestock (barley and combined forage) and to pay for transportation services. As this is Samvel’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for transportation services

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family.
